story:
The Inverness Poncho – raingear that fits in your sporran!

The Inverness Poncho is produced and is available immediately in all sizes. Order here:

www.theinvernessponcho.com

A 10% discount will be applied to orders of 12 or more!

Every kilt wearer has gotten caught in the rain without their rain cape – owning an Inverness Poncho ensures that will never happen again.  The Inverness Poncho is the rain cape that comes in a pouch that is small enough to be conveniently stored in your glove compartment, your bagpipe or drum case, your purse, the cargo pocket of your pants – and yes, even in your sporran when you are kilted and on the go.

I don't wear a kilt... why do I need an Inverness Poncho?  While The Inverness Poncho was designed specifically as emergency raingear for someone who would otherwise wear an Inverness Cape, anyone kilted or not could certainly use a more fitted poncho that frees the arms yet protects the arms from the rain, via the cape.  The price and size of The Inverness Poncho make it inexpensive and convenient for anyone to be prepared for wet weather at any time. Hunters, fishermen, hikers, campers, birders, boaters, sports enthusiasts, soccer moms and dads… keeping an Inverness Poncho in your glove compartment, cargo pants pocket, or purse means your day outside can never be ruined by unexpected rain.  Perfect for sporting events and outdoor concerts!

I'm a kilt wearer and I already own an Inverness Cape... why do I need an Inverness Poncho? The Inverness Poncho is less than half the price of a typical synthetic Inverness rain cape, yet twice as useful being so small when folded. The potential uses of such conveniently-small emergency raingear are countless – for example, a pipe band might issue these to members to keep in their sporrans when weather threatens but has not broken – in this way the band’s uniform appearance, something every band works hard to perfect, will not be marred by those large, unsightly rain cape belt packs, and, if eschewing those, the band won’t get stuck without raingear should the rain begin mid-performance.  Pipe Majors might keep a couple in their cases for those times one or two band members forget their Inverness Capes - it happens!  In fact, kilt-wearing musicians of any type might keep one in their instrument cases at all times, “just in case.”  A Drum Major friend of mine suggested that one might tuck an Inverness Poncho inside one’s feather bonnet  - it will fit!  And The Inverness Poncho will most definitely fit in one of the cargo pockets of those utility-type or “tactical” kilts and, of course, in the cargo pockets of cargo pants or shorts, or in one’s handbag.  

Specs:  The Inverness Poncho is a water-proof black poncho that is styled after a traditional Inverness Cape. It is made of proprietary-weight polyester taffeta, which is both sturdy and lightweight. The cape portion has arm straps to keep the cape in place, protecting your arms and anything you are carrying under your arms from the rain, and the armholes in the poncho portion have been designed to allow bagpipers to tuck their instrument against their clothing rather than against the slippery raingear fabric.  The collar has an adjustable drawstring that you can tighten to keep the rain out. The black storage pouch containing your Inverness Poncho measures only approximately 4” by 2” by 1” (varies by cape size).  Check out the photos above to see each of these details on the final Inverness Poncho prototype.

Sizing:  The Inverness Poncho is available in four sizes:

Small – maximum chest circumference 36”, length 42” (fits youths or petite adults up to 5’1” tall)

Medium – maximum chest circumference 46”, length 47” (fits folks with slim-to-medium builds up to 5’8” tall)

Large – maximum chest circumference 54”, length 48” (fits folks up to 6’3” tall)

XL – maximum chest circumference 62”, length 49”  (fits folks up to 6’6” tall)

**Size should be selected based first upon chest or hip circumference, whichever is widest – your poncho will fit comfortably up to and including the maximum circumference indicated for each size - then according to height**

Backstory, and the plan:  Brought to you by the creator of The Airy Glengarry, the world’s first and only lightweight, breathable mesh glengarry, The Inverness Poncho was born of a conversation with Dan Lyden - friend, Professional bagpiper in the EUSPBA, and early adopter and supporter of The Airy Glengarry.  Thanks to Dan’s suggestion, and after a many-month R&D period in which several prototypes of different fabrics and dimensions were made and adjusted, I  settled on the final design, material, and sizes, and now production is complete.  The inital pre-orders have shipped and The Inverness Poncho is now available in all sizes! I

The Inverness Poncho – order today and put one in your sporran!

www.theinvernessponcho.com

"Like" our Facebook page for promotions, sales, and news!

"Like" our Facebook page for promotions, sales, and news!

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Kerrie Gill. I'm a veteran, and entrepreneur who wants to make a difference.
  • We've taken something that doesn't degrade naturally over time in the elements, and repurposed it into something else that everyone needs: shoes.
  • After nearly 4 years of passionately searching for a solution, and 1 year of trial and error to develop them, we have finally developed our first edition, high-quality comfortable sandals made using recycled tires. Our next step is to purchase molds that will allow us to develop our second edition: sandals with straps made from recycled plastic.  

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • The extrusion process for recycled plastic is different than using virgin plastic, so we have to purchase new strap casings and molds. Each mold costs $5,681 to produce. We will need one mold for men's sizes, and one for women's. So far we have raised $10,000 to pay for the molds, now the goal to raise an additional $10,000 to pay for the inventory. Any additional funds raised will be used for R&D efforts to develop additional functionality like arch support, new treads, and anti-microbial features.  
  • For a $25 contribution, you’ll receive one pair of 1st Edition Sandals. For a $50 contribution, you’ll receive one pair of pre-ordered 2nd Edition Sandals, and for a $100 contribution, you’ll receive a pair of both 1st Edition sandals now, and a pre-order for 2nd Edition Sandals.
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, 1% of the funds will still go toward the African children's charity of donor's popular choice, and the rest will lie in waiting until we have gathered enough through sales and other means to purchase the inventory.  

The Impact

  • This is the first step of many in our efforts to educate and inspire consumers, allowing them to do their small but collectively mighty part in spreading the word and being aware of where their products go when they're done loving them.

Risks & Challenges

Our Indiegogo campaign ends on September 27, 2017. If we have raised enough, we'll go straight into production with our manufacturer and have our 2nd Edition sandals in hand (and on feet) by March 2018, just in time for Spring Break.

If we fall short, and you were a $50 or $100 contributor, we may not be able to get 2nd Edition sandals to you until next summer. We will continue to push sales and funding efforts to achieve our next edition sandals, but can't be sure how long this will take.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, but believe in what we're doing, here are other ways you can help:

  • Find us on Instagram @savannasandals, Facebook, and Twitter - follow us and put up a post to share with your network. 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out.  

And that's all there is to it.

This is the first step of many in our efforts to educate and inspire consumers, allowing them to do their small but collectively mighty part in spreading the word and being aware of where their products go when they're done loving them.

Our Indiegogo campaign ends on September 27, 2017. If we have raised enough, we'll go straight into production with our manufacturer and have our 2nd Edition sandals in hand (and on feet) by March 2018, just in time for Spring Break.

story:
A new voice in the gun control conversation had emerged: students.

Joined by vocal parents and teachers, vows of “Never Again” are now leading efforts to stop this from happening again. 

Sock Problems will give 25% of all proceeds to Make Schools Safe, founded by Lori Alhadeff who has dedicated her life to protecting the lives of children at school. We support Lori as she refines her mission and foundations goals and works towards achieving what we all want to see; safer schools and no more lives lost to gun violence. 

At Sock Problems, we aspire to give individuals who want to “sock” gun violence a sock that helps them express how they feel. This particular design came to life thanks to the help of High School students nationwide. 

 

 

Student Call For Art

The process of creating this sock was born from the desire to give students a platform to illustrate how they felt about this looping current event. We reached out to teachers across the nation asking their students to participate in the creation of this sock. We also shared our call for student submissions on our social media channels. 

Students from all over the United States submitted designs. Our team chose the top 4 sketches based on concept, colors, attention to detail and messaging. We then put the above four finalists up for vote on social. 

The winning design came from Paulina Markowski, a sophomore from Union High School in Union, New Jersey. Her concept posed a choice for a young boy climbing up alphabet blocks that spelled 'E N O U G H'. When the child reached the apex of the blocks, his out stretched arm looked to grasp either a gun...or a book. 

 

Keeping the integrity of Paulina's work, we did think it was necessary to incorporate 1) the color orange; which is the color of the gun violence movement, and 2) the POV, if possible, of Parkland. We were fortunate enough to receive feedback from Marjory Stoneman Douglas High Schooler and activist Delaney Tarr. With her input, we feel good about the final sock design.

 

 

If you knew  Sock Problems before today, you'll note this is the first time we've launched a sock outside our SockProblems.com website. Sock Problems sets out to "sock" pressing world issues with cause-centered socks. 

We recognize that Indiegogo is a platform that allows us to serve all of our distinct backers in unique ways. For example, students may care enough to wear then share our Sock Gun Violence sock on their social media feeds while parents or activists may take advantage of the option to send pairs (and pairs of) socks to their Senators in Congress. For a select few, perhaps a unified PTA or Principal, someone may choose to purchase socks for their entire student body with the schools name stitched into the sock. 

By going this route, we provide supporters varying ways to engage in our efforts to “sock" gun violence. 

Thanks in advance to anyone who chooses to back this campaign.  To all of those passionate students, parents, teachers, activists or principals who read this far, I hope you will stand in a sock that was designed to stand with you. 

- Ryan Berman, Sock Problems Founder

story:
We're not products of our environment. We want our environment to be a product of us.

Through conscious capitalism & philanthropy, we plan to provide consumers with quality goods while simultaneously providing support, love and care for the community. Inspiration breeds inspiration. Not only will GHH give every effort to provide an excellent service experience, we plan to educate, motivate and reshape our business with value and integrity. If you thought this paragraph was too cheesy, we shortened it.

 

We created this brand because we feel society and civilization has one objective. That objective is to be better. It starts with all of us, but more importantly, it starts with a good human heart. In addition to producing apparel, we plan to host and sponsor various community service projects throughout the country helping humans and animals in need. Do good while looking good.

We want our environment to be a product of us.Through conscious capitalism & philanthropy, we plan to provide consumers with quality goods while simultaneously providing support, love and care for the community. Inspiration breeds inspiration. Not only will GHH give every effort to provide an excellent service experience, we plan to educate, motivate and reshape our business with value and integrity. If you thought this paragraph was too cheesy, we shortened it. We created this brand because we feel society and civilization has one objective. That objective is to be better. It starts with all of us, but more importantly, it starts with a good human heart. In addition to producing apparel, we plan to host and sponsor various community service projects throughout the country helping humans and animals in need. Do good while looking good.

story:
If you’re a size 14 or larger, you know there’s nothing worse than poor-fitting, uncomfortable activewear.

You need a product that moves with you, flatters your curves, makes you feel confident, and looks as good on its hundredth wear as it does on its first.

What makes us different

Featured in:

Testimonials

 

Created with curvy women in mind

We know that plus size women have often been an afterthought in the activewear market — we say no longer! Unlike our competitors, Lola Getts is made exclusively for the 67% of women in the United States who wear a size 14 or larger — that means all the style, fit decisions, and cuts are made specifically with YOU in mind. We fit all our garments on a size 16 model rather than sizing on a 4 or 6 and scaling up. We refuse to go into production until our product is perfect for you.

High quality fabrics and smart design

We use the highest grade of fabric in all our design.

We shop the technical fabric market and choose fabrics that are soft and luxurious but still have the right amount of stretch and compression, allowing for a worry-free wear every time.

We strategically place every seam on our garment to enhance and support your curves. Our diamond shape crotch guarantees a camel-toe-free wear and our flat lock stitching means no more worrying about chafing or opening seams.

Stop sacrificing

Curvy women have often had to choose between style, comfort, and performance. To us, it is just as important to have a great fitting garment as a long-lasting one. That is why we are so particular about the fabric we choose, how we sew it, and who we trust to manufacture it.

Every time you wear your Lola Getts, we want it to feel and look like your very first time, so that once you wear the Lola High Rise you will never want to wear another pair of leggings, guaranteed!

 

 

 

Fits and flatters

Our Lola Getts leggings are figure-flattering, helping you to feel tucked in without sacrificing comfort, mobility, or performance. We use seams that elongate your natural lines, a waistband that stays put, and fabric that smoothes and flatters without being see-through. We always want you to feel comfortable and confident.

Shape retention design

Invest in a pair of Lola Getts leggings’ with our unique shape retention design and end saggy knees and baggy waists for good!

Comfortable and functional

Our fabric is substantial — we use a 480 gram weight supplex/lycra that has the right amount of compression to smooth everything out while still being comfortable, and of course won’t pill. You can be sure your leggings will never slow you down.

Say goodbye to sweaty clothes

No one likes their clothes damp and sweaty after a long hike or workout. Lola Getts leggings use quick-drying, naturally moisture-wicking fabrics, helping you feeling fresh and clean — no matter how active you are.

No more chafing

Chafing is the worst — that's why we use flat-lock stitching in all of our leggings. We want you to be confident and comfortable.

 

 

Shrink, fade, and wrinkle resistant

Who doesn't love the look and feel of brand new leggings? Our leggings are shrink, fade, and wrinkle resistant because of the fabric we choose. So you'll have that 'brand new legging' look and feel for months or even years of wear. We know you will not have to constantly replace your Lola leggings. This is better for the Earth and even better for your wallet.

Low maintenance, high quality

Our leggings are 100% machine washable — just hang or tumble dry on low heat to maintain your leggings’ shape.

Women helping women

Do you have a pair of old Lola Getts that doesn't fit but is still usable? Send it to us to donate to someone in need so she can start her fitness journey and you'll get 20% Off.

Made in America

Lola Getts believes in supporting local communities and economies, providing fair wages, and ensuring the quality of our products. We are proudly made in America.

Money back guarantee

Meet the Lola Getts team

Timeline

We are very grateful to our backers. That’s why everyone who makes a pledge will receive a code for 20% off a future purchase from lolagetts.com!

Sizing

 

Risks and Challanges

For the 67% of women who wear size 14 and larger, the choices of premium activewear are minimal. They are clearly the forgotten majority. Too often we ask the plus size woman to sacrifice quality, fit and design, because no one has embraced her needs. So many plus size women are stuck wearing baggy T-shirts and saggy leggings, while our straight size counterparts have all the fashionable options in the world for activewear.

We wanted to reduce this disparity of options by designing a legging that would fit and flatter plus size women while encouraging them to feel confident and comfortable in their activewear.  We have spent 3 years designing the perfect legging and we’ve elevated it to a new level by introducing the Lola High Rise. Each seam is carefully placed, fabric selectively chosen, and stitching meticulously sewn to create the ultimate, curve-flattering, long-lasting wardrobe staple.

The Lola High Rise is ready for production in our Los Angeles factory -- all that’s missing is you. We are looking for at least 400 women to fund our first production run and make the Lola High Rise a reality. If you pledge today, you will be one of the first women to own the best high rise legging made exclusively for the plus size woman. Can a legging make someone feel empowered and confident? We believe so...  please pledge, please share and become part of the strong Lola Getts Community.


FAQ:

1. Q: Are the leggings true to size? What size should I buy?

A: Yes, they are true to size. Please refer to our size chart, and if you are still not sure, please be sure to ask for our help.

2.  Q: Do you ship outside the US?

A: We can ship to Canada for an additional fee of $23.00

3.  Q: What are the washing instructions?

A:  We recommend that you machine wash cold and line dry.

 4. Q: Can I order multiple offers?

A: Absolutely!

5. Q: I have more questions. Who should I ask?

A: You  can email us at info@lolagetts.com

We are proudly made in America.Money back guaranteeMeet the Lola Getts teamTimelineWe are very grateful to our backers. That’s why everyone who makes a pledge will receive a code for 20% off a future purchase from lolagetts.com!Sizing Risks and ChallangesFor the 67% of women who wear size 14 and larger, the choices of premium activewear are minimal. They are clearly the forgotten majority. Too often we ask the plus size woman to sacrifice quality, fit and design, because no one has embraced her needs. So many plus size women are stuck wearing baggy T-shirts and saggy leggings, while our straight size counterparts have all the fashionable options in the world for activewear.We wanted to reduce this disparity of options by designing a legging that would fit and flatter plus size women while encouraging them to feel confident and comfortable in their activewear.  We have spent 3 years designing the perfect legging and we’ve elevated it to a new level by introducing the Lola High Rise. Each seam is carefully placed, fabric selectively chosen, and stitching meticulously sewn to create the ultimate, curve-flattering, long-lasting wardrobe staple.The Lola High Rise is ready for production in our Los Angeles factory -- all that’s missing is you. We are looking for at least 400 women to fund our first production run and make the Lola High Rise a reality. If you pledge today, you will be one of the first women to own the best high rise legging made exclusively for the plus size woman. Can a legging make someone feel empowered and confident? We believe so...  please pledge, please share and become part of the strong Lola Getts Community.
FAQ:
1. Q: Are the leggings true to size? What size should I buy?A: Yes, they are true to size. Please refer to our size chart, and if you are still not sure, please be sure to ask for our help.2.  Q: Do you ship outside the US?A: We can ship to Canada for an additional fee of $23.003.  Q: What are the washing instructions?A:  We recommend that you machine wash cold and line dry. 4. Q: Can I order multiple offers?A: Absolutely!5. Q: I have more questions. Who should I ask?A: You  can email us at info@lolagetts.com

story:
***ORDERS WITHIN U.S.A. MUST BE PLACED BY DECEMBER 19 TO ENSURE CHRISTMAS DELIVERY***

Our Story

Meet Ashley, a South Florida native turned New Yorker after heading to the Big Apple in 2014 to start her namesake label. Ashley learned to make jewelry four years ago as an afternoon hobby at a local Florida bead store. Four years ago, while Ashley was working as an independent medical sales rep, the Healthcare Industry took a nose dive due to reimbursement cuts. This left her scrambling for a job and forced her to do some serious soul searching before making her next career move. She took refuge in creating jewelry and was amazed at just how much attention her jewels sparked when she wore them – and even the amount of women who would buy them right off her body!

Ashley packed her bags and headed for NYC with nothing but a whole lot of drive, determination, and one hell of a dream. Within weeks of launching in 2016, the line was featured in People Style, Esquire, and Cosmopolitan Magazine. During that time, Ashley also landed a deal with Equinox fitness clubs hosting trunk shows in The Shop(s) at their New York City locations. This year, the line was picked up by The Shop at The Montauk Beach House in The Hamptons, Tictail Market in New York City, and BLVD in Manhattan Beach, California. Her jewelry was also recently seen on The Today Show being worn by Hoda Kotb. 

The Short: The purpose of this campaign is to generate funding for Ashley and her team to manufacture marketing materials and samples so that they can pitch to the buyers of larger "brick-and-mortar" and online retail stores. Creating samples can be very costly due the 14k gold filled material they have committed to using - opposed to their "fashion jewelry" competitors who use cheaper, lower quality gold plated materials. Somewhere along the line, Ashley had this wild idea: why not make fine jewelry more accessible? Why not tap into the gap between high and low, between Tiffany's and Fashion Jewelry, and create luxury jewelry for every day? With your help, we can create samples to show off our jewelry in person, and let buyers give it a real test run; allowing them to wear it during their busy everyday lives, during their workouts, and even during their showers, so that they can experience and truly vouch for its' everyday  sustainability! As a backer, you have the advantage of receiving an Ashley Carson original piece (or pieces) at a steep discount that you'll likely never see again. We hope to make you proud to be a part of the campaign that launched a hard working, small town girl's dream of creating a sustainable, lifestyle jewelry line and bringing it to high-end retail shelves all over the world. Please continue reading to learn more!

 

 

 

 

Our Mission

Ashley Carson Designs aims to create a delicate, sustainable, yet versatile lifestyle jewelry line. Because this line sprung from Ashley’s love of stylish sustainable jewelry (and the market’s lack there of), she continues to design for women looking for on-trend, high-end jewelry that won’t break the bank. We believe in layered and stacked transitional sets that transition from soft and sweet, to sultry and seductive, any time of day. We are advocates for conscious consumption and ethical production. We aim to not only educate our customers about styling and caring for their luxury items, but bring an awareness to the impact that the fashion industry has on our planet as well.

Our Collection

What makes Ashley Carson so unique is easily its' versatility - its' ability to be styled up or down, and worn on special occasions or for everyday. Our dainty jewels are crafted to last decades without chipping or tarnish. Never again will you have to set aside your favorite body chain or necklace for only "special occasions," due to the fear of wearing it out. Our products are so versatile you can wear them nearly anywhere:

 

We design using strictly 14k gold filled materials. Most of our competitors use  gold plated materials, creating a collection that is doomed to chip and tarnish after only a handful of wears. The Ashley Carson collection is created to last. Ashley’s jewelry easily pays itself off times ten over, considering the amount of years it will stay like-new, chip and tarnish free!

What Exactly is Gold Filled?

The layer of gold alloy on gold-plated jewelry is so minuscule it is barely noticeable in the above image. Gold-filled jewelry has 100x more gold alloy than gold plated and because that layer is so much thicker, it means gold-filled jewelry lasts longer and stands up to wear and tear better than gold plated. All it would take is one small scratch on a gold-plated piece to expose the jeweler’s brass underneath.

Why is there such a difference in the amount of gold alloy? The answer lies in the manufacturing process:

 

To make gold-filled pieces, the core metal is sandwiched between two layers of gold alloy which is then heated and passed through a roller several times – a process that both bonds the metals together and thins the sheet out. 

To make gold-plated pieces, an electric current is used to negatively charge the base metal and positively charge a solution containing gold ions. The positive gold ions are attracted to the negative charge of the core metal, slowly forming a layer of gold on top of the core. 

 

 

But Ashley, if it doesn't chip or tarnish, why isn't everyone using gold filled?

 

We wondered the same thing at first! However, using gold filled drastically limits a designer's creative freedom, as it cannot be cast (molded) into shapes/designs, unlike its counterparts: solid gold and gold plated. Manufacturing gold filled is very complex and involves a chemical bonding process and gold weight standardization. Because of this, it is also much more expensive. Even Ashley was frustrated when she made the switch from plated to gold filled...but certainly not as frustrated as when her plated jewelry would tarnish on her over and over again! It was an exciting challenge learning to create something unique with just chain and stones; however, it resulted in a line built to last decades that is suitable for virtually any occasion!

What You Get

Not long ago, if you wanted luxury jewelry you had to either wait for a gift box to appear under the Christmas tree or visit a traditional jeweler with an intimidating security entrance and a hushed atmosphere. However, coming to you just in time for the holiday season, we've curated perfectly gift-able packages composed of Ashley's favorite sets. Ashley takes the guess work out of it by selecting pieces and styling them into neat little packages wrapped up in a bow! 

Why You Should Invest

Up until September 2017, Ashley has been a one-woman show in terms of: manufacturing (making the jewelry herself), order fulfillment, sales, marketing, advertising, accounting, recruiting, and all administrative duties. Aside from a $3k loan she crowdfunded through another organization in September 2017, there has been absolutely no fundraising. Ashley built her entire business from the money she's saved by living in her "shoebox apartment," while slinging drinks, waiting tables, and checking coats in New York City. 

Ashley's ingenuity and work ethic are the driving forces behind how far she's been able to single handedly take her business. However, Ashley's network/networking capabilities speak volumes for the projection of what she is capable of doing. Every brand listed below has featured Ashley's line in some capacity; all without funding, paid placements,  or business partners.

Bloomingdale's SoHo approached Ashley, just about one year ago, about hosting trunk shows.  After many months of going through a rigorous approval process and finding herself within the top 3 finalist candidates, Ashley learned that Bloomingdale's approvals process changed due to internal management and now would be run from another office, putting Ashley back at square one. Now, in exchange for some beautifully designed jewelry, you can help us begin again and reach our next stepping stone - getting into high-end retail.

Who's Wearing Ashley Carson

 

Testimonials

 

 

FAQ

I have very sensitive skin, and can only wear "real" gold. can I wear your jewelry?

Yes!  You're probably traumatized from a purchase or a gift gone wrong in the past, right? Your skin had a reaction, and now you believe you can only wear "real" gold. Well, we would bet on the fact that you weren't wearing gold-filled. We've tested our jewelry on dozens of women with sensitive skin and allergies to metals, and have not once had a problem. However, everyone's skin is different, so if you do have a reaction within the first 14 days of item delivery, send us a photo of the skin irritation and we will be happy to refund it for you.

I can be clumsy and am worried I'll damage the dainty jewelry. help!

We recommend being cognizant and body conscious of where and how the jewelry is laying on your body. If you're someone who likes to twerk in a fitted silk gown that you spent an entire paycheck on, you might want to be on the lookout for our upcoming Instructional/Care YouTube channel. But on that note, Ashley's worn every piece in the collection over dozens of times – she's even dove off a 60-foot yacht and swam a good 75 yards in one of her body chains. Hey, desperate times call for desperate measures!

Does your jewelry come in sizes?

Almost all necklaces, chokers, and body chains come with extenders so that you can adjust the piece to your preference. Our rings are offered in standard sizes 2-9 and our bangles are offered in 3 sizes: small, medium, and large.

What's the return policy?

Within 14 days of item delivery date, if unworn and no damage has been made to the item, we can issue store credit.

I'm buying as a gift; can I speak with someone directly to ensure i'm getting the correct size/style/fit?

Absolutely! Give us a call at 212.653.0072, reach out to us on messenger, or email care@ashleycarsondesigns.com, and we'll be happy to help!

How should I care for my jewelry?

Rule number one, be gentle! Avoid snagging your jewelry on other materials and do not pull aggressively on them. Store each piece separately so that it does not tangle. Never just throw it in your purse! If you did not opt to buy one of our nifty travel cases (they're only a couple bucks, and definitely worth the investment), and you need a solution, we recommend storing your necklace or body chain inside a straw, then placing it in a plastic ziploc baggie. However, we offer much more glamorous travel and at-home solutions in our online shop and encourage you to check them out! 

I had a problem with my order, what can I do?

Within 14 days of the item delivery, give us a call at 212.653.0072, reach out to us on messenger, or email care@ashleycarsondesigns.com, and we'll be happy to help!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Follow us on Instagram or Facebook--we'll be offering flash sales throughout holidays and announcing on social media
  • Not finding what you're looking for...hop on over to our website!
  • Share our campaign with friends, family, and via social media platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, or LinkedIn.
  • Join our VIP newsletter to stay in touch about specials, new style launches, stay ahead of the trend with styling & care tips from our NYC-based designer, and upcoming special events.

story:
How do you foster a culture of innovation in Calgary?

By working together as designers and engineers, we've developed a new genre of culture in Calgary; the wearable tech fashion scene. Calgary has the most active wearable tech fashion scene we know of. 

We aren't talking about gadgets on your wrist.

We are talking about enchanting garments that allow true personal expression. 
Fashion that can shift color, monitor your vitals, help with muscle rehabilitation, respond to incoming notifications, change shape to adapt to weather and many other useful functions. 


This is the future of fashion and technology. We call it MakeFashion.

For three years we've collaborated to organize the MakeFashion Runway & Gala. Each of the 28 pieces created this year had hundreds of hours, and thousands of dollars invested. We, as designers and engineers, have been working together to elevate each other, making the engineering more beautiful, and making the beautiful more functional. 

Everything we create is for the love of exploring what is possible (and what isn’t...yet). We hope to advance our vision and start solving real personal health and habit problems as well as enriching people's lives through human expression that was never before possible. 

..........................

Designer: Erina Kashihara

What we need help with:

The 2015 MakeFashion show was sponsored by Seeed Studio, and they have now offered us an opportunity to work with them in Shenzhen, China. There, we'll be working in their makerspace to imagine and create a interactive fashion show for the Maker Faire Shenzhen. We plan to be in Shenzhen from June 2-23. 

Seeed Studio has contributed $5000 to getting us there for that time.

This is an incredibly vital step to furthering our art. In this case, the technology we are using originates from our destination. We want to travel to the source and help influence what is being developed, and to show the technology companies what we are creating.

..........................


Your donations will help us with the following:

-Securing a videographer to produce a documentary.

-Cover costs for flights, room and board.

-Acquire the necessary materials and accessories to make our high fashion garments for the world to see on the runway.

..........................


Why should you help us?

As a supporter,  you'll get to follow along with us online and watch how our exploration of technology and fashion develops . Follow us on exciting shopping trips for components in the massive electronics markets, creating the wearable tech fashion, and fitting electronics inside our own high fashion creations. 

You will also have access to perks listed on the sidebar. Unique handmade products, VIP Tickets to see the next MakeFashion show in March 2016 in Calgary, and many others.

Together we hope to make an impact on the global technology scene and show the world, and the 100,000+ people at the Maker Faire, what can come from the city of Calgary. 


Who are we?

Shannon Hoover.(T) Founder of Calgary Maker Faire, MakeFashion and Archeloft (Previously Endeavor Arts space)
Maria Hoover.(T) Co-Founder and Director at Calgary Maker Faire. Co-Founder of MakeFashion. Owner/Curator at ArcheLoft, wearables lab and Maker Space.
Catherine Hazin. Artistic Director of Make Fashion, Editor for Calgary Bride, and Director of Arts and Culture at Canadian Space Society.
Paul Spenard. (T) MakeFashion Video Producer, Photographer, Videographer at Eye Squared.
Kyle Nylund. (T) Mens Visual Stylist at Nordstrom. 
Kelly Hofer. (T) Photographer and Chief Storyteller at Kelly Hofer Studios, Director of Photography at Business on Camera. 
Sophie Amin. Electronics Engineering Technologist at Gentherm Global Power Technologies.
Kenzie Housego.(T) Owner/Operator at Squint Media; Designer for Phi: Illuminated Design
Stacey Morgan. Designer for Phi: Illuminated Design 
Jason Bedard. (T) Producer for Maker Faire Calgary, Founder Calgary Maker Foundation, MakeFashion engineer and Maker

We are making an impact!

Here is a quote from Dale Dougherty, the Founder and Executive Chairman of Maker Media, MAKE Magazine, and Maker Faire,  regarding our shows at Bay Area Maker Faire - the original and largest fair, it hosts over 1000 makers and around 150,000 attendees.

"One of the highlights this year was the “MakeFashion” show, organized by Shannon and Maria Hoover from Calgary with a group of wearables designers, and developed along with our crew member, John “Parts” Taylor.

It was an incredible, moving experience that created a new genre, using the fashion show model to hack the fashion show and transform who gets to walk down runways and what they are wearing. This show featured fashion for the differently-abled, for men and women, as well as for children. Thousands of people watched. To see prosthetic limbs featured as a multi-colored LED fashion statement was to feel joy and compassion. Everything was stunning and I loved seeing the look on the faces of young girls and women in the audience."

https://medium.com/make-and-maker-faire/the-mot...

Owner/Curator at ArcheLoft, wearables lab and Maker Space.Catherine Hazin. Artistic Director of Make Fashion, Editor for Calgary Bride, and Director of Arts and Culture at Canadian Space Society.Paul Spenard. (T) MakeFashion Video Producer, Photographer, Videographer at Eye Squared.Kyle Nylund. (T) Mens Visual Stylist at Nordstrom. Kelly Hofer. (T) Photographer and Chief Storyteller at Kelly Hofer Studios, Director of Photography at Business on Camera. Sophie Amin. Electronics Engineering Technologist at Gentherm Global Power Technologies.Kenzie Housego.(T) Owner/Operator at Squint Media; Designer for Phi: Illuminated DesignStacey Morgan. Designer for Phi: Illuminated Design Jason Bedard. (T) Producer for Maker Faire Calgary, Founder Calgary Maker Foundation, MakeFashion engineer and Maker
We are making an impact!

Here is a quote from Dale Dougherty, the Founder and Executive Chairman of Maker Media, MAKE Magazine, and Maker Faire,  regarding our shows at Bay Area Maker Faire - the original and largest fair, it hosts over 1000 makers and around 150,000 attendees.
"One of the highlights this year was the “MakeFashion” show, organized by Shannon and Maria Hoover from Calgary with a group of wearables designers, and developed along with our crew member, John “Parts” Taylor.

It was an incredible, moving experience that created a new genre, using the fashion show model to hack the fashion show and transform who gets to walk down runways and what they are wearing. This show featured fashion for the differently-abled, for men and women, as well as for children. Thousands of people watched. To see prosthetic limbs featured as a multi-colored LED fashion statement was to feel joy and compassion. Everything was stunning and I loved seeing the look on the faces of young girls and women in the audience."
https://medium.com/make-and-maker-faire/the-mot...

story:
I’m passionate about shoes. They’re what I love. Ever since I the first time I saw Michael Jordan play basketball, all the way back in 1988, I knew that I wanted to work with shoes. In some way, in some capacity, shoes had to become my life. The drive inside me was that strong. I was totally captivated. Then, as a senior at Washington University in St. Louis, I simulated the creation of a shoe start-up for my thesis project. This was a great learning experience for me, and after graduation, I accepted the position of creative director at a shoe startup based out of Memphis. Soon after that, the startup sent me to China on a six-week business trip. During those six weeks, however, the startup went under. Instead of returning to the comfort of the States, I decided to stay in China and see what I could learn.

What I saw will always stick with me. The conditions in the shoe factory were abysmal, often unspeakable. The workers’ health was failing collectively, and the environment was unsafe in a lot of glaringly obvious ways. Every day I went home with a headache or a stomachache, sick from breathing in the fumes with which these people were living their lives, months, years, decades apiece. While I picked up a good many lessons relating to creating the shoe themselves, my main takeaway from this experience was what I wanted to do differently. I was as devoted to shoes as ever, but now with a caveat: I must do no evil in the world along the way.

My name is Jamien Sills, and I am the founder of HEROS Footwear, a small shoe startup based out of Tennessee. I recently ran my first half marathon after losing more than 100 pounds, and in doing so, I have decided to focus the attention of HEROS on HOPERUNNER, a specialized running shoe for people like me. HOPERUNNER is designed to be lightweight and durable with a unique structure that compensates for supination or pronation, a condition in which people run on either the inside or the outside of their feet. Because HEROS is unlike any other shoe company, we will be donating $30 from every shoe sale to St. Jude’s Children’s Research Hospital, the charity of choice of HOPERUNNER’s namesake, Chris Hope, whose running group Team Hope has themselves raised thousands of dollars for St. Jude’s already.

Right now, we are turning to you, Indiegogo, for help raising $50,000. This capital will cover the costs of manufacturing, marketing, and distributing HOPERUNNER. We have already gone through two prototypes on this shoe, and we are just about ready to get it out to market. Your contributions will make that possible. Thank you.

Life. Hope. Achievement. These are the values upon which HEROS FOOTWEAR operates. We are a team of scientist-athletes, dedicated to producing a shoe that is better in every way, a shoe that improves on aspects that other shoe companies have come to ignore, a shoe that is made from runners’ minds with runners’ needs and wants at heart. The HOPERUNNER is the culmination of hundreds of hours of study and experimentation. Super lightweight at just 10.5 ounces, wearing a HOPERUNNER has the feel of an ultra-supportive sock. Designed to reduce foot fatigue and to facilitate a smooth heel-to-toe transition, HOPERUNNER will encourage longer and more intense runs by creating a comforting environment for your foot. Plus, with our “O-ring” support system, which locks the top of the shoe over your foot without any pinch, you will wonder why the traditional shoelace is not already a thing that we only read about in history books. Truly, HOPERUNNER is the shoe of the future, brought to you today with steady work and smart effort.

Both developed and tested by a marathon runner, these shoes were most recently worn in competition at the St. Jude’s Marathon in (city). Each HOPERUNNER shoe is named after someone who has fought cancer: the pink is Rosalind, after the designer’s sister who passed away from breast cancer in February 2015, and the blue is Eli, after a survivor who was treated at St. Jude’s.

We are looking to raise $50,000 in funding in order to fully launch the HOPERUNNER and HEROS Footwear. We will use the funds to order and distribute the initial inventory in both colorways. We currently manufacture in China, and must order a significant amount of units for our first run. As stated, we will donate $30 from EVERY pair sold to St. Jude Children's Research Hospital, so you're not only funding a socially conscious start-up, you're also supporting one of the greatest organizations on the planet. After the launch of the HOPERUNNER, we have an extensive line of footwear products built specifically to solve the footwear needs of the EVERYDAY HERO, that we will be rolling out. We are also looking to eventually manufacture our products in the US by utilizing a 3D printing process coupled with organic materials that we have already begun research and development on. 
If we are not able to reach our full goal, we will use the funds to order at least one colorway of the HOPERUNNER. Once that colorway is successful, we will offer other colors based on the season.

HEROS is footwear for the EVERYDAY HERO. We are problem solvers, providing footwear solutions for the unique needs of the EVERYDAY HERO. We are not a typical shoe company, All of our products will derive directly from the needs, input, and feedback of  the EVERYDAY HERO.We will innovate and reinvent in order to accommodate the EVERYDAY HERO. We are committed to producing Eco-friendly footwear and bringing our manufacturing back to America, and making shoes with purpose. 

HEROS is not only about making shoes for the EVERYDAY HERO, we are about supporting the EVERYDAY HERO. A portion of the proceeds of EVERY shoe we make will be donated to St, Jude's Children's Research Hospital. We will also be partnering with non-profit and charitable organizations to design a shoe, and raise money for their cause. A portion of the proceeds of their shoe will be shared with their organization as well as St. Jude. Every shoe we make, no matter the color, will feature a crimson red lining to show our support and pay homage to St. Jude. 

Our risks mostly involve manufacturing and shipping from China. We have been working closely with our manufacturers since 2007 and have built a trusting relationship. We know who is making our shoes, and that they are treated well, and paid a fair wage. The risks come from production being delayed by either being placed behind an abundance of orders, labor strikes, and natural disasters. The same applies to shipping by sea, delays and even loss can occur due to natural disasters or accidents. We will purchase insurance and use a very reliable and reputable shipping company that we have built a relationship with.  

Now, thanks to Indiegogo, we have a platform to present the HOPERUNNER to you, the EVERYDAY HERO. We need your help to bring this product to the market. Knowing that the HOPERUNNER is just the beginning, we will continue to innovate and revolutionize the shoe industry. Our goal is to become the best shoe company in the world by providing the footwear solutions that you need. We will be there with you, because we are here for you. We need your help to get the word out to as many people as possible, so please share this on your social media feeds, email, text, and with friends, family, and co-workers!!

I want to thank you in advance for your support. 
You are Our Hero!

story:
Hello, my name is Lorenzo. I have a passion which started very early in life. When I was a child I used to look at people and ‘extract’ pieces or components of their look, convinced that everybody has at least one good item to be evaluated. Then one day I finally decided to transform my sensitivity into a tangible reality, and I created Stabole. {Sta-bo-lay}

Wearing a Stabole piece will bring you to the centre of attention. For the right reasons.

Our wish is to create pieces that will make you stand out in a crowd. We want to make sure you get to enjoy the very best of Italian craftsmanship and the high quality of Tuscan leathers. Contemporary yet timeless design, attention to detail and an urban feel – our  mission is to let you explore the classics of tomorrow.


THE PROJECT

The strength of Stabole is in the search of a real object identity, the project itself is fuelled by a keen eye for detail, materials and the active involvement of buyers. Our goal is to make the vision of ‘contemporary tradition’ a reality, transforming it onto something that everyone can appreciate and live in daily life.

Stabole bags are for all those who really want something unique with a taste of tradition and want to feel that they are making a radical yet traditional choice. We design products without frills but with finishing that only a craftsman would be able to make coming in valuable soft, candid hides or in worn-out looking, smelling leather. 

For our collection we have chosen a unique material: a soft and vegetable-tanned horse leather. With this leather, prepared in the traditional way but with a contemporary finish, it is possible to achieve high quality handbags. We aim to keep ‘the art of tan’ alive, producing fine handbags with the help of some of the finest craftsmen in Italy.

Become part of this project.

Our collection takes the tradition of true Italian craftsmanship and joins it with experimentation and design. It’s here that unusual and precious materials inspire intense suggestions enabling us to create handbags and accessories ensuring the combination of dynamic lines and volumes, colours and materials.

This Stabole collection is by far our favourite and it is dedicated to both women and men. We spent a lot of time seeking the finest leathers in Tuscany, selecting creative colours and creating made-to-measure accessories. 

We’re excited to present you with our collection and to have the chance to launch it worldwide. By creating a crowdfunding project, we hope to raise funds for the production of the collection, representing a new form of the recovery of Italian tradition in its highest form of art: the craft of quality.

We would love your support in helping us bring it to life!

Our team sought out to create Stabole because of our passion for luxury leather handbags and a desire to cut out the brand inflation and retail markup of popular name brands.

The new definition of ‘luxury’ should be based not only on a brand name or a price tag. It should refer to brands that bring real added value to consumers, which offer a unique overview, an original concept that expresses the emotions, passion and inspiration of the designer who created it. Luxury is in the search for high quality and innovative materials, it’s in the detail, in the rediscovery of handcrafting and ‘Made in Italy’, in global access to small but top quality products, in specialists with a very unique identity. 


THE COLLECTION

TORINO WEEKENDER (BLACK/GREY/MUSTARD)

$495 INDIEGOGO | $820 RETAIL

Dimension: 55x35 cm
Leather: soft horse hide
Internal canvas: 100% cotton 
Details: handle drop, adjustable strap, metal feet, internal zip pocket, 2 external zip pockets, 1 external big pocket
Available colors: black, grey, mustard

Leather: soft horse hide
Internal canvas: 100% cotton

Available colors: black, grey, mustard


BOARIO BACKPACK (BLACK/GREY/MUSTARD)

$379 INDIEGOGO | $550 RETAIL

Dimension: 35x32 cm
Leather: soft horse hide
Internal canvas: 100% cotton 
Details: metal handle drop, adjustable strap, internal zip pocket
Available colors: black, grey, mustard


LINA CLUTCH (BLACK/GREY/MUSTARD)

$249 INDIEGOGO | $370 RETAIL

Dimension: 23x14 cm
Leather: soft horse hide
Internal canvas: 100% cotton 
Details: metal handle drop, adjustable strap, internal zip pocket
Available colors: black, grey, mustard



B-TONE SHOULDER BAG (BLACK/GREY/MUSTARD)

$339 INDIEGOGO | $510 RETAIL


Dimension: 40X32 cm
Leather: soft horse hide
Internal canvas: 100% cotton 
Details: adjustable strap, internal zip pocket, external zip pocket
Available colors: black, grey, mustard

CROSSCOLORS SHOULDER CASE 
(BLACK/GREY/MUSTARD/NATURAL GREEN)

$199 INDIEGOGO | $270 RETAIL

Dimension: 40X30 cm
Leather: soft horse hide
Internal canvas: 100% cotton 
Details: shoulder strap, internal zip pocket
Available colors: black, grey, mustard, natural green

TWINS COIN PURSE (WITH  YOUR MONOGRAM)
(BLACK/GREY/MUSTARD/NATURAL GREEN)

$45 INDIEGOGO | $85 RETAIL

Dimension: 9X9X9 cm
Leather: soft horse hide 
Details: personalized with your monogram (2 characters)
Available colors: black, grey, mustard, natural green


PERK $20 - CONTEST "NAME THAT BAG"

Contribute with $20 and get the chance to win an Italian design bag named after you!

Our next bag needs naming and we want to thank you by making you part to our project. Post on your favorite social your comment on “why you should become the next Birkin”. We’ll let your social friends be the judge. Become your very personal luxury bag! It's very simple.

  1. To participate, simply contribute to our campaign and share the link of our Indiegogo project (http://igg.me/at/stabole-bags) on your Twitter or Facebook. Add a comment on "why you should become the next Birkin", the contest title “Contest: Name that bag!” and tag Stabole.
  2. Your shared descriptions must contain the hashtags #handbags #Stabole #madeinitaly #Indiegogo.
  3. Submit the web link of your shared post by November 31, 2015 to stabole@gmail.com (if you have shared more than once, please submit only the one post which has the most likes). “Shares” must come from your own followers, friends or groups you belong to.
  4. If your post gets the most votes, you win!

Winner will be announced on December 15th 2015 after all likes are verified (in case of tie, we'll let our designer be the final judge). If we will reach our campaign goal you will receive the first bag named after you.

Join and purse-onalize it!


PACK 1 (TORINO WEEKENDER + LINA CLUTCH)(BLACK/GREY/MUSTARD)

WITH THIS PACK GET AN EXTRA 5% DISCOUNT OFF RETAIL

PACK 6 (PAPIN SHOPPING BAG + CROSSCOLORS)(BLACK/GREY/MUSTARD)

WITH THIS PACK GET AN EXTRA 5% DISCOUNT OFF RETAIL

$511 INDIEGOGO | $780 RETAIL


MATERIALS

Our leathers come from Tuscany. Here the art of leather tanning can be traced back to the middle ages, where tanners and craftsmen have existed since the 14th century. We use vegetable-tanned leather. From hides to distressed smelling leather, Stabole bags are synonymous with the tie existing between the object and its producer.

The leather

Horse leather is only obtained from the dorsal/back side of the horse. To obtain this particular quality of skin, besides the traditional process still followed today, a further touch is needed.

This begins with the process of fleshing which goes on till the right thickness is obtained; then the skins are spread and softened using an ancient tand-tool called ‘palmella’ and finally the skins are greased and polished using glass and stone hand-tools. 


TALKING ABOUT US

Fault Magazine

Lorenzo Pezzi designs an exclusive range of beautifully hand-crafted bags which combines contemporary style with quintessential Italian craftsmanship at its highest. Bespoke bags made to order with loving attention to materials, detail and sublime colour palettes to choose from. The finest expression of luxury.
Kurv Magazine

Stabole, Italian Handcrafted Handbags. 

An entire line of Italian handcrafted bags produced with high-level materials and quality details, the fusion between traditional techniques and creative Energy. With style. Lorenzo Pezzi, the designer behind the Stabole collection, wanted to realize a vision, transforming it into innovative and appealing products. Harmony and contrast of shapes, dynamic lines, colours and materials, mixed together in various combinations.

Laura Tonatto, fragrances creator

"First time I saw Stabole bags in a magazine during a trip to London, has been love at first sight and I contacted the company for a small production made-to-measure. Linear and elegant design and details are the first thing that struck me. Then feel out precious materials, all items with an unique taste (and smell), a fascinating journey back into the history of Italian handcraft handedness. I don't love brands performed and tags that often disrupt the beauty of conceptual objects, but I love discovering the pure expression of the sensibility of the designer, and products that enclose a loving care and a search of details. An amazing discovery!"


THE TEAM

Contemporary craftmanship, timeless design.

Stabole is an independent bags design studio who set out to build a brand with substance and truth. We believe that to be relevant, the design needs to be personal, simple and long lasting. We try to reduce our negative impacts by choosing better materials and production practices and by working together with knowledgeable partners who share our ambitions. We aim to  represent a new form of recovery of the Italian tradition in its highest form of art: the craft of quality. 

WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT!

In order to turn this dream of ours into a reality, we need your support. Not only does this mean pledging for one of our awesome bags, but sharing the story with a friend. The important thing to remember with Indiegogo is, if we don't reach our full funding goal....we get nothing.  If you could do something as simple as tweeting about our page, or just liking our Facebook page, it can really go a long way. Simply click the Facebook and Twitter tabs at the bottom of the page.

We'll update you frequently about our progress.

SHIPPING

The vegetable-tanned leather we use takes more than 40 days to get ready. And all our products are handmade by the best craftsmen. But the results worth your patience. Thank you for understanding. 

We have planned to begin shipping the goods on March 15th

Duty/VAT charges: If you live outside Europe, you will be responsible for any applicable duty/VAT charges. 

We'll update you frequently about our progress,

Thank you!

the Stabole team

www.stabole.com

$511 INDIEGOGO | $780 RETAIL


MATERIALS

Our leathers come from Tuscany. Here the art of
leather tanning can be traced back to the middle ages, where tanners and
craftsmen have existed since the 14th century. We use
vegetable-tanned leather. From hides to distressed smelling leather, Stabole
bags are synonymous with the tie existing between the object and its producer.
The leather

Horse leather is
only obtained from the dorsal/back side of the horse. To obtain this particular
quality of skin, besides the traditional process still followed today, a
further touch is needed.

This
begins with the process of fleshing which goes on till the right thickness is
obtained; then the skins are spread and softened using an ancient tand-tool
called ‘palmella’ and finally the skins are greased and polished using glass
and stone hand-tools. 




TALKING ABOUT US




Fault
Magazine

Lorenzo
Pezzi designs an exclusive range of beautifully hand-crafted bags which
combines contemporary style with quintessential Italian craftsmanship at its
highest. Bespoke bags made to order with loving attention to materials, detail and
sublime colour palettes to choose from. The finest expression of luxury.
Kurv Magazine
Stabole, Italian Handcrafted Handbags. 
An entire line of Italian
handcrafted bags produced with high-level materials and quality details, the
fusion between traditional techniques and creative Energy. With style. Lorenzo
Pezzi, the designer behind the Stabole collection, wanted to realize a vision,
transforming it into innovative and appealing products. Harmony and contrast of
shapes, dynamic lines, colours and materials, mixed together in various
combinations.

Laura Tonatto, fragrances creator
"First time I saw Stabole bags in a
magazine during a trip to London, has been love at first sight and I contacted
the company for a small production made-to-measure. Linear and elegant design
and details are the first thing that struck me. Then feel out precious
materials, all items with an unique taste (and smell), a fascinating journey
back into the history of Italian handcraft handedness. I don't love brands
performed and tags that often disrupt the beauty of conceptual objects, but I
love discovering the pure expression of the sensibility of the designer, and
products that enclose a loving care and a search of details. An amazing discovery!"
THE TEAM



Contemporary craftmanship,
timeless design.
Stabole is an independent bags design studio who set out to build a
brand with substance and truth. We believe that to be relevant, the design needs to be personal, simple and long
lasting. We
try to reduce our negative impacts by choosing better materials and production
practices and by working together with knowledgeable partners who share our
ambitions. We aim to  represent a new
form of recovery of the Italian tradition in its highest form of art: the craft
of quality. 
WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT!
In order to turn this dream of ours into a reality, we need your support. Not only does this mean pledging for one of our awesome bags, but sharing the story with a friend. The important thing to remember with Indiegogo is, if we don't reach our full funding goal....we get nothing.  If you could do something as simple as tweeting about our page, or just liking our Facebook page, it can really go a long way. Simply click the Facebook and Twitter tabs at the bottom of the page.
We'll update you frequently about our progress.





SHIPPING



The vegetable-tanned leather we use takes more than 40 days to
get ready. And all our products are handmade by the best craftsmen. But the
results worth your patience. Thank you for understanding. 
We have planned to begin shipping the goods
on March 15th
Duty/VAT charges: If
you live outside Europe, you will be responsible for any applicable duty/VAT
charges. 

We'll update you
frequently about our progress,
Thank you!
the Stabole team
www.stabole.com

story:
Short Summary:

Novel is an ethical clothing line by the co-founders of UNCHAINED.

Our Company:

Novel ensures dignity and transparency from our sourcing, to manufacturing, to our delivery whereby you can confidently wear a better story.

With highest levels of transparency and quality, we ensure that all our fabric is slave-free using organic, sustainable materials that won't harm the environment.  As a result of fast fashion, many major clothing companies utilize factories that exploit workers through debt bondage, forced labor,  involuntary child labor and with extremely dangerous working conditions to make the clothing we wear everyday.  Novel believes in doing things differently. We are starting Novel in Ohio, creating dignified, transparent and sustainable jobs by manufacturing our garments here in the U.S. As we grow, we will empower survivors of human trafficking and those at risk of being trafficked through employment opportunities with Novel.   We need YOU to partner with Novel to change the course of history for people and the planet. YOU are the hero of this story. 

The Novel Campaign:

With your partnership, the funds raised from this Indiegogo campaign will bring the first Novel collection to market. Novel needs YOU to help us make this a reality. 

We are raising $20,000 for the following:

  •  Fabric - Purchasing ethical  fabric to manufacture our garments 
  • Manufacturing - The manufacturing of our sample garments  
  • Bringing Novel To Market - Photography & Website
                                                   

 Our First Global Partners:

  

Novel is working with a silk supplier in Siem Reap, Cambodia that only works with sustainable, natural dying methods and gives sustainable jobs to women in need.  All of our Fall 2016 Collection will have elements of silk hand-crafted by these incredible artisans.


                         Fall 2016 Collection

                                      

(From Left to Right) Elodie Dress, The Caroline, Tatiana Pant, Zaria Top

                                                'Illustrations by Mimi Honeycutt'

                                                      'Edited/inked by Jake Kiley'

(From Left to Right) The Summer Pant, Isadora Kimono Robe, The Mimi Dress, The Pearl Coat, The Madeline Top

The Impact:

By contributing to Novel, you are partnering to create a sustainable, high-end fashion line  that will allow people to wear a better story.  You are also helping us:

  • Create sustainable manufacturing jobs in the U.S. , with the eventual goal of sustainable dignified jobs across the globe. 
  • Help train individuals at risk of exploitation including survivors, homeless and refugees
  • Help lift individuals out of poverty
  • Raise awareness about the injustice of fast fashion and labor trafficking

Risks & Challenges

On the journey of starting Novel, we have experienced many risks and challenges.  We have done in-depth research on all our fabric materials from farm to factory, the limited amount of ethical choices has taken great work and certainly has not been an easy process.

 However, we are committed to partnering with organizations choosing ethical practices, ethical materials of utmost quality from around the world, supporting co-ops, fighting for the rights of farmers, and creating sustainable jobs in the process.

Our History: Given our background, we are sure that Novel will succeed.  We have past experience in launching product to fight human trafficking that has proven successful.  UNCHAINED introduced a bracelet in THE LIMITED stores nationwide in 2015 that raised  $32,500 for the UNCHAINED Survivor Scholarship Fund that was awarded to 2 survivors of human trafficking in January of 2016.  

Definitions:

Ethically Sourced: Ethically sourced means fair and safe labor practices, including outlawing child labor. It also ensures that workers are paid a fair price for their labor. 

Certified Organic: The World Health Organization (WHO) estimates that approximately 22,000 people die each year in developing countries as a result of the chemicals sprayed on non-organic cotton.  All of our materials are GOTS (Global Organic Textile Standard) certified organic.  Certified Organic means that both the production of the fibre on the farm, and the processing of this fibre into textiles has been checked at every step of the processing supply chain, has met organic standards and is certified by one of the many governing bodies. Organic textiles  fibres are free from herbicides, pesticides or anything genetically modified.  

Natural Dyes: Our raw materials for the dyes are taken from nature rather than constructed from dangerous chemicals.  We value the health of our clients by utilizing organic textiles and natural dyes since chemicals used in dyes are absorbed into the skin and can be harmful, specifically to those that suffer from asthma and allergies.

Other Ways You Can Help:

- Please like and share our Novel Facebook page!

- Promote us on social media and contact anyone you think would be interested in contributing financially to our campaign.

- Make some noise about Novel! 

- Please share this campaign with your friends and anyone that would be interested in wearing a better story!

story:
Shamma Mama

For years I have been styling people just out of my own closet.  I educate women on how to dress in a way that is in full alignment with who they REALLY are.

I give them the experience of wearing clothes and jewelry from indigiounous cultures.  Items that are hand made and filled with loving energy.  I introduce them to natural fibers and unique designs.  I allow them to feel the magnificence of flowing fabric that makes you feel naked... accept better.

I have been traveling the world creating a small collection of prized items that I have been sharing with my friends and clients.  But it always makes me sad when they can't go home with the pieces that they have fallen in love with.  

So... I have had this vision of a clothing and accessory line called ShammaMama.  Now the first step of this would be creating a a moveable closet, a van with a full wardrobe station inside.  So that I pull up and we fully style you right there on the spot.  

This would be a collection of clothes and accessories and what I call 'activation pieces'.  It would be a 1 stop shop of amazing things from around the world available for purchase.

The bigger vision?  To have a full online sales structure filled with clothes, accessories, home goods, etc.  But to start I have a simple mission... to gather a collection of delicious finds from Bali.  

Your contribution will help me make the initial purchases to get this up and running. 

I have had a lifetime of experience in searching for the best items.  I grew up with a mother who was an interior designer.  I would travel the world buying antiques and having them shipped back to the states.  I grew up studying the visual natures of each culture and learning how to identify true authenticity.  

Throughout the years, this knowledge has morphed as a photographer and stylist.  

For as long as I remember I have held the vision of having a brand that held the passion of beautiful fabrics interwoven with the intrigue of history.

It is time...

You have all been asking for this...

What We Need & What You Get

So what do I need???

$5,000 would allow me to purchase the needed supplies for the initial launch of my moveable closet.  This would allow me to create enough inventory for a 6 week tour throughout California.  

During this 6 week tour I will be doing private photo shoots along with creating private concerts featuring higher conscious women singers.  Basically I am bringing the best features of the higher conscious movement on tour with me to help more people connect with the new side of hippie.

I believe that there is a new era of hippie.  The women that still loves beautiful things while being connected to their essence instead of ego.  

My hope is to bring them the supplies that help them with that. 

So what happens if I don't raise all the funds?  I still move forward with this project. It just means that I will have less inventory.

And... if I raise above the asking price??? Then I get to move into stage 2 of the fundraising.  If I raise $10,000 I would get to go to India and Thailand on the way back to the states!  You can't even imagine the fun stuff I could bring back that you all would LOVE!

The Impact

Lets be honest... We will all survive if this doesn't happen.  But wouldn't it be so much fun if it did???

Risks & Challenges

I am under the gun with timing.  I am currently in Bali where I can purchase a lot of these items.  But I need the funding immediately and need your help to spread the word.

It is hard to describe what I do or why people should believe in my talents.  So it helps if you share it for me.  Please share with your friends any experiences you have had with me.  

I need your support.

Also, if you have been wanting to do a shoot with me but haven't been able to afford it, I ask that you sign up now.  I am placing all the money from my shoots into this project for the next 3 weeks.  I am offering a hugely discounted price ($550) for my personal and $1,200 for my Branding Shoot.  Please pass it on.

Other Ways You Can Help

Low on funds?  Believe me, I have been there!  

What would be almost better then you contributing?  Hand select 3 people and tell them about my campaign and why you think they should be interested.

Also... I LOVE $10 contributions

Check out www.ShammaMama.com for more examples of my photography and more info on the items offered in this campaign.

And a million Thanks for taking your time to support me!

story:
We met by chance, just like you and your best friend. For you it was most likely a mutual hobby, school, work, or beer, that brought you together. For us it was socks; an inconspicuous piece of clothing, which has the power to express who we are. Courage and creativity are our strongest traits. These are clearly visible in the design and color of our socks. Do you want to be courageous as well?


The golden rule is, THERE ARE NO RULES. Let's be honest, contrast is the new black. Vibrant, yet simple design is clearly portrayed in each pair of FunnySOX.


We're in it for you, for us, and for them. 
For You: With a simple pair of socks, you can make a better day for yourself and for the people around you.
For Us: We thrive on people, who are non-conformist and who ignore the rules of conventional fashion rules.
For Them: For every ten pairs of FunnySOX sold, we are obligated to donate one pair to less fortunate people in developing countries. Why? 


The story of FunnySOX sparked in my head again by chance. I was wearing a pair of green socks with color dots while visiting Ethiopia. A young boy named Kaleb noticed my socks and came up to me to ask me about them. His English was very broken, but I could understand that he liked them and it turned out, that his family couldn't afford to buy Kaleb socks like mine. That was when the story of FunnySOX began. Right there and then I made a promise to myself to one day help people and families just like Kaleb's. I still have those socks to remind me what they stand for.


  • Our goal is to raise €30K and gain global brand recognition
  • The funds raised will be used to expand our stock, create further designs. Furthermore, we need to invest in our sales channels and global expansion
  • In return, we offer you the highest quality socks, while at the same time you are contributing to a good cause. 
  • Men's socks come in a 'one size fits most' size 41-45
  • Women's socks come in a 'one size fits most' size 36-40

At FunnySOX we believe it is important to give back to the less fortunate:

  • we are therefore donating socks to countries, where people are unable to afford our socks
  • we have thus far been able to save 263 pairs of socks and will be donating them to a country chosen by our fans in a poll
  • it is now your time to make a difference!


Building a global brand requires time, dedication, and funding. It takes a long time to build a globally recognizable brand, especially when the brand is a startup brand operating less than a year. We feel that our dedication is strong enough that we can succeed with the help of our fans, friends and backers in generating a large enough funding, so that we can expand our brand globally. 

  • We stay true to the saying: THINK GLOBALLY ACT LOCALLY


We appreciate any kind of help from your side. Whether it is backing our campaign, sharing our campaign on social media, and recommending us to your friends and family. Make sure to share our video, make use of Indiegogo's sharing platform, and/or back our campaign by purchasing our perks.
