story:
Short Summary 

I am a babywearing, design-centric, mother of two. I want to create a business that supports small artists making handwoven cloth based on my designs. Astra V Designs is currently myself and one weaver (my best friend from my highschool years!). We need funds for safety testing and certification as a baby product, business licensing, and a larger loom. My passions for this business are supporting our local fiber mill, sourcing ecological and sustainable fibers, and creating high quality artisan cloth.

What We Need & What You Get

  • $2300 for our own loom and warping reel (we are currently borrowing time from a gracious friend),  $5100 for starting materials, $4600 for certification, safety testing, and licensing. 
  • We are offering a one-of, crowdfunding exclusive design series of handwoven baby wraps and handbags. Also, a rare semi-custom slot!
  • If we don't reach our goal, we will continue using our friend's loom and, after fulfilling prizes, will launch with handbags first.

The Impact 

  • You are integral in letting us return to a time of high-quality, handmade cloth. The kind of cloth that legacies are made of. Your funds allow us to focus solely on this project, without having to divide our attention on "day jobs" to fund this process.
  • Starting a business in California is expensive! But we love keeping it local and we love our California vibe!
  • This project is also special to me because I really love babywearing and it would be more than special to wear my babies in my own designs. Only trouble, they only stay small for so long, and while I'm certainly up for some toddler and child wearing challenges for fun, it definitely makes this project time-sensitive for me!

Risks & Challenges

 There's a chance that some of my designs will not translate well and fibers are like wine--there are good years and bad years. To prepare for those obstacles, I'm training in drafting and we've researched a lot of sources, so we can insure that we are giving you the quality of cloth we claim.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell everyone you know! Share with your design friends, share with your babywearing friends, and new moms and moms-to-be! Share with people who love a quality bag to haul their gear! Share with people who love fashion and making their own clothes--our cloth might be a source of inspiration for them! Let's make this happen together.

story:
Over the past three years, the Senegalese ready-to-wear brand, Bélya, has grown from a small, home-based business to an internationally-recognized brand, known for its high-quality, hand-made products using West African textiles and leather. With a successful online e-shop and a Dakar-based boutique, the brand has reached a critical point. Bélya seeks to adapt its business model by engaging with women in rural areas in the production of its fabric. We hope to build a workspace in the village of Lompoul in Northern Senegal, where we will train and employ at least twenty local women to dye and sew fabric, while earning fair wages to support their families and communities. Additionally, this workspace will double as a classroom where employees will learn how to read and write as part of our literacy initiative. At Bélya, we strongly believe that Africa's development depends on the full and fair economic inclusion of women. Your support will enable us to make a positive contribution towards this goal in Senegal.

Needs

With this Indiegogo campaign, we plan to raise the money necessary to:

  • hire workers to build the workshop;

  • hire instructors to conduct continuous professional skills training in fabric dying and sewing;

  • pay the salaries of the workshop staff;

  • purchase sewing machines, workstations, dyes, stamps, wax, cotton fabric, and other materials; and

  • pay for operational costs including transport between Dakar and Lompoul.

  • pay literacy teacher

In order for our local workshop model to become fully functional and self-sustaining, we will need around $50,000. The $20,000 for which we are asking through the current campaign will lay the foundations for the future growth of Bélya . The remaining $30,000 will be raised through sales and offline fundraising events. Within the next year, we hope to be in the position to expand our production activities to other villages outside of Lompoul.

Impact

Women living in Lompoul and throughout rural Senegal face compounding challenges that make their daily lives difficult and limit their personal aspirations. Young girls are typically not encouraged to think for themselves or to gain skills they could use to build brighter futures for themselves and their families. Rather, they are taught that their role in the community is limited to being a good wife and completing domestic duties. Bélya hopes that by establishing a safe and dynamic workspace where women will gain skills and confidence, girls and women will realize that they are able to fill many different roles in their communities, and people will see that investing in women is worthwhile. This includes language instruction for women, most of whom are illiterate. Furthermore, Northern Senegal is part of the Sahel region, a semi-arid band south of the Sahara Desert that suffers from chronic food insecurity as a result of climate change. Teaching a trade to community members improves their resilience against these hardships.


All of those who donate at least $10 will have their names engraved on the first wall constructed of our Lompoul workshop. To thank you for your financial contributions, Bélya will offer and send you any of the following items from its newest collection that match the amount you donated. Feel free to claim the item of your choice.













Risks and Challenges

In rural West Africa, businesses and NGOs too often misinterpret the needs of the people they are trying to support. When projects are not in line with community goals and aspirations, they are highly unlikely to be sustainable in the long run. Communities come to distrust outside actors who implement projects in their villages and fail to follow-up once they have left. We expect that building community trust will be an important challenge for us to overcome. For this reason, Bélya's founder has selected Lompoul, a village in which she has strong familial ties, to pilot the first of many workshops. Bélya has already done the groundwork of meeting with key community members in Lompoul and of identifying women eager to participate in this initiative. Since Lompoul is only a 4-hour drive from Dakar, the Bélya team will able to keep in close contact with those operating the workshop on a daily basis. This proximity will also enable those in Lompoul to participate in the creative evolution of Bélya.

100% of Bélya's products are hand-made. Already, this requires a significant commitment of time and resources. With the opening of its Lompoul workspace, Bélya is now shifting from its previous model, which included exlusively buying ready-made textiles, to overseeing the production of its own fabrics. Such a transition will slow down textile production, especially in the earlier stages of the workshop. This is another reason why Bélya stresses the importance of long-term investment in communities. Through continuous training, the women working for Bélya in Lompoul will become more knowledgeable and efficient. Trainings on sewing will be led by Bélya's primary tailor, a trusted professional with much experience training people new to the field.

Other Ways to Help

Your financial support will greatly contribute to our work, however, if you are unable to donate at this time, there are other ways for you to support our work! Please share this campaign with those in your social networks, visit our website www.belyashop.com, like us on facebook: www.facebook.com/cridejoie, and follow us on instagram @belyashop and Twitter: @belyamode
story_txt:
Over the past three years, the Senegalese ready-to-wear brand, Bélya, has grown from a small, home-based business to an internationally-recognized brand, known for its high-quality, hand-made products using West African textiles and leather. With a successful online e-shop and a Dakar-based boutique, the brand has reached a critical point. Bélya seeks to adapt its business model by engaging with women in rural areas in the production of its fabric. We hope to build a workspace in the village of Lompoul in Northern Senegal, where we will train and employ at least twenty local women to dye and sew fabric, while earning fair wages to support their families and communities. Additionally, this workspace will double as a classroom where employees will learn how to read and write as part of our literacy initiative. At Bélya, we strongly believe that Africa's development depends on the full and fair economic inclusion of women. Your support will enable us to make a positive contribution towards this goal in Senegal.
Needs


With
this Indiegogo campaign, we plan to raise the money necessary to: 



hire
	workers to build the workshop; 
	


hire
	instructors to conduct continuous professional skills training in
	fabric dying and sewing;


pay
	the salaries of the workshop staff;


purchase
	sewing machines, workstations, dyes, stamps, wax, cotton fabric, and
	other materials; and


pay
	for operational costs including transport between Dakar and Lompoul.

 pay literacy teacher


In
order for our local workshop model to become fully functional and
self-sustaining, we will need around $50,000.  The $20,000 for which
we are asking  through the current campaign will lay the foundations
for the future growth of Bélya .  The remaining $30,000 will be
raised through sales and offline fundraising events. Within the next
year, we hope to be in the position to expand our production
activities to other villages outside of Lompoul.  
ImpactWomen living in Lompoul and throughout rural Senegal face compounding challenges that make their daily lives difficult and limit their personal aspirations. Young girls are typically not encouraged to think for themselves or to gain skills they could use to build brighter futures for themselves and their families. Rather, they are taught that their role in the community is limited to being a good wife and completing domestic duties. Bélya hopes that by establishing a safe and dynamic workspace where women will gain skills and confidence, girls and women will realize that they are able to fill many different roles in their communities, and people will see that investing in women is worthwhile. This includes language instruction for women, most of whom are illiterate. Furthermore, Northern Senegal is part of the Sahel region, a semi-arid band south of the Sahara Desert that suffers from chronic food insecurity as a result of climate change. Teaching a trade to community members improves their resilience against these hardships.

All of those who donate at
least $10 will have their names engraved on the first wall
constructed of our Lompoul workshop. To thank you for your financial contributions, Bélya will offer  and send you any of the following items from its newest collection that match the amount you donated. Feel free to claim the item of your choice.



Risks and Challenges

In
rural West Africa, businesses and NGOs too often misinterpret the
needs of the people they are trying to support.  When projects are
not in line with community goals and aspirations, they are highly
unlikely to be sustainable in the long run. Communities come to
distrust outside actors who implement projects in their villages and
fail to follow-up once they have left.  We expect that building
community trust will be an important challenge for us to overcome. 
For this reason, Bélya's founder has selected Lompoul, a village in which she has strong familial ties, to pilot the first of many
workshops.  Bélya has already done the groundwork of meeting with
key community members in Lompoul and of identifying women eager to
participate in this initiative.  Since Lompoul is only a 4-hour drive
from Dakar, the Bélya team will able to keep in close contact with
those operating the workshop on a daily basis.  This proximity will
also enable those in Lompoul to participate in the creative evolution
of Bélya.  


100%
of Bélya's products are hand-made.  Already, this requires a
significant commitment of time and resources.  With the opening of
its Lompoul workspace, Bélya is now shifting from its previous
model, which included exlusively buying ready-made textiles, to
overseeing the production of its own fabrics.  Such a transition will
slow down textile production, especially in the earlier stages of the
workshop.  This is another reason why Bélya stresses the importance
of long-term investment in communities. Through continuous training,
the women working for Bélya in Lompoul will become more
knowledgeable and efficient.  Trainings on sewing will be led by
Bélya's primary tailor, a trusted professional with much experience
training people new to the field.  



Other Ways to Help

Your
financial support will greatly contribute to our work, however, if
you are unable to donate at this time, there are other ways for you
to support our work!  Please share this campaign with those in your
social networks, visit our website www.belyashop.com, like us on facebook: www.facebook.com/cridejoie, and follow
us on instagram @belyashop and Twitter: @belyamode

story:
What is the SnapDrive?

The SnapDrive is a modular distortion/overdrive/fuzz pedal which allows you to design effects in minutes, using modules that can be swapped out and arranged in any order, each one with it's own function and flavor. Using this concept, you can mix and match different modules and achieve a fully custom setup & a tone all your own!


What makes it different?

The SnapDrive is cost effective and easy to use. You don't need to be an engineer to start tinkering and creating. Within minutes, you can dial in the tone you've always wanted.


Open Source?

SnapDrive is built around an open source concept. We plan on allowing other manufacturers to design & offer their own modules, allowing consumers to get exactly what they envision, block by block. Want an EQ model from your favorite company and an Overdrive module from us? The SnapDrive brings this to reality!


Features

  • Analog Sound

SnapDrive is a fully analog effects system. Its modules are based on popular, vintage stompboxes.

  • Easy to Use
SnapDrive blocks can be easily removed and placed in different positions and combinations by the use of specially-designed magnetic connectors.
  • Cost Effective

By what you need and want!

  • Robust Enough for Live Performance
SnapDrive is constructed out of solid sheet metal, and it's as durable as any stompboxes out there, even for live performance!

  • Studio Quality
SnapDrive offers many routing options, and with the help of gold-plated, specially-designed pogo pin connectors, your sound is transferred without any signal loss or quality degradation. This makes the SnapDrive on par with any boutique pedal!

  • Ability to Incorporate Other Effects/Stompboxes

Don't leave your favorite pedals behind! SnapDrive offers a high quality loop that can be placed anywhere in the circuit. Connecting your pedals to the loop gives you the ability to tinker with them by adding different blocks in different positions in the signal chain.

  • True Bypass

SnapDrive offers true bypass! Each module has a circuit which prevents signal degradation.

  • Expandable

Not only will we be offering new modules in the future, but with the use of our open source philosophy, you'll be able to purchase modules from your favorite manufacturers!

  • Block Compatibility on Future Platforms

Future products, like SnapRack and SnapCombo, will support all pre-existing modules.

  • 9-volt Output Supply

SnapDrive has a highly-filtrated 9V output power supply that can be used to power your external stompboxes.

  • Modules Sold Separately According to Needs

You can buy as many modules as you want separately!


Featured on


How You Can Help

The SnapDrive is at the proof-of-concept phase right now. We have to make a pre-production prototype before kickstarting the product. This initial funding will help us build a polished prototype, which will then get us to the next stage of production and so we can get the SnapDrive out to market.

  • The Money

The estimated cost of 3 prototypes is $6,000 USD, which includes the design and production of the enclosure and coverage of the MOQ, or minimum order quantity, for some of the parts (connectors and potentiometers).

  • Spread the Word

Along with contributing, letting people know about the SnapDrive goes a long way. It costs nothing to share this campaign on social networks, and we'd really appreciate the help!

  • Our Approach: Crowdsourcing

We want to make sure people are happy with the design of our product. Send us your thoughts and ideas, and let's build the SnapDrive you want.


The Team

We are enthusiasts that started this project with almost no budget. However, we are professionals. We have completed many R&D projects and have prepared production for other companies we have worked for. We also have a passion for music. Combining these traits, we strive to bring about innovation and a world of musical possibilities with the SnapDrive.


What you get

  • The T-Shirt


  • The Picks


Questions and answers

Why do you offer t-shirts and picks instead of the SnapDrive?

SnapDrive is at proof-of-concept stage. We have to do a lot of work on design and tuning before going to production. So we need to build decent prototypes which are hard to finance in this early stage without venture capital. We decided to raise money to finance this early stage by offering T-shirt and guitar picks as a thank you for helping us bring the SnapDrive to market.

When do you plan to complete the project?

This is a tough question. Prototyping is not fast and neither is the production. We also can't give a 100% guarantee that there won't be any hiccups, and from our experience, there usually are. If we meet our campaign goal, we plan to have working prototypes in June and be ready for production in September, provided there are no major setbacks. We're aiming to have the product ready by December 2015.

What does the SnapDrive include?

Actually, we're still working on that. There are new ideas coming in everyday, but we have 10-15 basic modules designed. The starter kit will include a mainboard which will support 6 modules and a set of 12 modules or so. This will allow the user to have access to a massive variety of combinations and sounds.

Can I buy modules separately?

Of course! You can buy as many as you want.

Do you plan to expand with new modules?

Yes. This is the basic concept of the SnapDrive. There will also be variations of the platform with more block support and 2- or 3-channel switching. We are also developing ideas such as SnapAmp and SnapCombo.

Can I reuse my modules on future SnapDrive platforms?

We will do our best to offer backward compatibility.

Is there something that can help you produce the SnapDrive faster?

Yes. There are 3 things: Money, money & more money. Having enough financial support will allow us to focus solely on the SnapDrive project. The goal of the campaign is $6k, but if it raises $20k or more, it will be a complete game changer.


AND DON'T FORGET TO SPREAD THE WORD ABOUT THE SNAPDRIVE!

story:
Seed to Sew grew out of my dual passion for organic farming and sustainable fashion.  

It also grew out of my need to find a tee shirt that I wanted to wear!  

I want to help consumers make more sustainable fashion choices by creating an affordable US farmer-grown organic cotton tee shirt that they can track from seed to sewn, dirt to shirt.  Know the farmer who grew your tee!

All steps in production of the tee shirts will take place in the US, as close as possible to the farms on which the cotton was grown.  This includes spinning the cotton into yarn, knitting it into fabric, and sewing the tees.

The tee shirts will be classic white round-neck in womens/mens sizes S, M, L and XL.

story:
Short Summary

Thank you for checking in on our Campaign, My name is Terrell Pitts and my business partner is my lovely wife Quinita Pitts. In 2005 I  received a Fashion Merchandising and Design Degree from Gibbs College in CT. Since I was in high school, throughout  college and after, I have always been driven to create fashion apparel. When my wife and I met, we discovered both of our families have been sewing and fashion designing for three generations.

ABUNDANT LIFE FASHION LLC

  • We have done Alterations and Tailoring for customers.
  • Customized Denim Jeans
  • Designed T Shirts
  • Created customized one of a kind garments
  • Fashion Shows

The Abundant Life Fashion Campaign is all about bringing our business to the next level. We would like to buy the equipment and fabric we need to  manufacture our own fashion line and launch an online store. Everyone that is willing to financially make contributions are also giving us the potential to create jobs for people in our local community in the future.

How much funds do we need & where are the funds going?

$60,000

  • purchase manufacturing equipment, fabric & material
  • Launching our website & Advertising our fashion brand
  • Fashion Shows & distribution

    • Manufacturing equipment is very important and vital. Contributors need to know this will help with more than half the battle. As a fashion designer, having the ability and the machinery to manufacture your own fashion line gives the advantage over competitors. Self manufacturing will allow us to have quantity control, quality perfection and pricing . Having the equipment to manufacture our fashion designs will open endless doors of opportunities.  Looking for manufacturing companies can take a long process, it can be costly and very time consuming. Instead of taking all the funds and paying another company to do the work for us, we can invest the funds into our business and produce the clothing apparel ourselves. 

    The Impact & What you get

    Everyone who contributes to our campaign is making an impact, whether big, small, or consecutive donations. 

    • Over the years prior to our business, even until now, we have worked very hard by freelancing, promoting, sewing, tailoring, jewelry making, fashion shows and fashion designing. We have worked very hard to reach our customers needs. One thing contributors should understand and know is, we are dedicated and determined to reach our goals and your contributions brings us one step closer to doing so.  
    • Over the years we have made garments and alterations for our customers. We believe with the help from contributors, we can offer our customers a strong, unique, and creative fashion brand with men and woman's apparel.

    Risks & Challenges

    Accomplishing a goal can be challenging but we have the courage to face the challenges, push toward success and reach our mark. 

    • Not being able to reach our financial goal is one of our biggest Challenges. The only way to overcome this challenge is to continue to do business and raise the money we need. We plan to raise money by giving fashion shows throughout the year and increase online advertising.
    • The fashion industry is very competitive, this is a challenge within itself that we are willing to take on. We believe our new clothing line will stand out among  competitors, giving consumers great quality and unique styles that are affordable.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    To those who don't have it in their power to donate, we understand times can be difficult but there are other ways you can contribute.

    *Spread the news through text message, word of mouth, emails, Social media, community groups, etc. your support is appreciated.

    Thank you.

story:
A little about us:

My name is Jeff Wagener, I came up with this idea after I watched an episode of Shark Tank on TV.  A person had flip flops with a saying embossed on the bottom.  I thought that idea was okay, but thought it would be nice if a person could personalize their message.  After several years of thought, I mentioned what I was thinking to a friend of mine, Jude Lague.  He agreed that we should get something going.  So then we went on to find manufacturers for what we needed.  I found a shoe manufacturer who would let us buy in  low volume.  Not only did they give me incorrect measurements so that the mold for the letters was wrong, in the end our entire shipment of flip flops was made incorrectly.  This ended up being a blessing in disguise, having then found our current manufacturer.  Our new manufacturer is great, but they have a much  larger minimum order quantity.  Which means a larger output of money up front.  So with your help, we can help those who want to make a statement, say it without saying a word.


About the shoes

The bottom of each sandal has velcro adhered to the sole in a recessed area which has space for you to place 10 characters any way you choose, get creative.  

Sand Traxx are made of high quality leather, have an anti-slip sole, an orthotic arch support, and are super comfortable.  They are made in the same factory as other top national brands (which we are not supposed to name).  The pledge amount is less than the price you would have to pay for these brands, and they do not even offer the ability to leave a message.  In the very unlikely event you are not satisfied with your Sand Traxx, your pledge will be refunded to you.

Each pair will come with two sets of alphabets, 8 spaces, as well as two each of: 1,&,#,$,? and two hearts. 

Sand Traxx will come in US men's sizes 8-13.  We will send a survey after the campaign to find out what sizes you need.

US   Euro     UK           Inches           CM

8   41           7.5        9.9375"       25.4




9   42 8.5        10.25"       26




10   43 9.5        10.5625"       27




11   44 10.5        10.9375"       27.9




12   45 11.5        11.25"       28.6
13   46 12.5        11.5625"       29.4
OOPS!  We made a mistake on the pledge amount of the Wedding Party Special.  It should be $289.  Since someone has already ordered it, we cannot change the number.  If you would like to order it, go ahead and we will refund you the difference.

                                   

                                                      Have fun on the beach!!!

Initially we will offer the dark brown as seen at the bottom of the photo above.  If we raise $15,000 we will offer black, and if we raise $20,000 we will add medium brown.

                                   

                                     

These are the characters you will receive.  Remember they are in a mirror image so they will read in the sand when you walk. 

                                         

Sand Traxx also come with a cotton bag.  Bring your extra letters to the beach, so you can change them at any time.


What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $10,000 minimum to cover the costs of remaking the mold for the characters.  (they need to be a bit thinner) we also want to make the mold so that when we cut the letters apart, there is no scrap to throw away (be nice to mother nature).  Also, they money will go toward our flip flop manufacturers minimum order quantity.  While the products are made overseas, final assembly which includes adhering the velcro to the soles and letters, as well as the cutting apart of the letters will take place at our facility in Minnesota. 

For your pledge you will receive a pair of Sand Traxx, 72 characters , and a cotton bag.  That's an amazing 75 pieces!  



Referral Program

For every $500  worth of pledges you refer to us, we will be happy to send you a free pair of Sand Traxx.


The Impact

Make a statement without saying a word!

Please help make it possible for those who may not have the confidence to say it out loud, at least make their mark and have fun while doing so.

 

Risks & Challenges

While our suppliers have high capacities, we may run into a scheduling problem.  When we get closer to the end of the campaign, we can reserve production time.  Once we get the sandals, letters and velcro, we take care of adhering the velcro on the sole of the flip flops and the back of the characters, and then we take those to Jet Edge to get them cut apart with a cool machine that cuts using water jets, hence the name I guess.

Stretch Goals

$15000 We will add black 


$20000 We will add medium brown


Other Ways You Can Help

If your are reading this and have decided not to pledge, you must at least think it's kind of cool, so we would appreciate if you would share this with those who you think may like this product.  Please use the indiegogo sharing tools to share with your friends.


Three members of our team pictured in front of the Jet Edge waterjet cutting machine that we use to cut our letters and characters:  Founder Jeff Wagener, Partner Jude Lague, and Head of Marketing Nancy Lauseng.


We have just been featured in the Minneapolis Star Tribune!  Check it out!

http://www.startribune.com/waconia-sod-farmer-c...
story_txt:
A little about us: My name is Jeff Wagener, I came up with this idea after I watched an episode of Shark Tank on TV.  A person had flip flops with a saying embossed on the bottom.  I thought that idea was okay, but thought it would be nice if a person could personalize their message.  After several years of thought, I mentioned what I was thinking to a friend of mine, Jude Lague.  He agreed that we should get something going.  So then we went on to find manufacturers for what we needed.  I found a shoe manufacturer who would let us buy in  low volume.  Not only did they give me incorrect measurements so that the mold for the letters was wrong, in the end our entire shipment of flip flops was made incorrectly.  This ended up being a blessing in disguise, having then found our current manufacturer.  Our new manufacturer is great, but they have a much  larger minimum order quantity.  Which means a larger output of money up front.  So with your help, we can help those who want to make a statement, say it without saying a word.About the shoesThe bottom of each sandal has velcro adhered to the sole in a recessed area which has space for you to place 10 characters any way you choose, get creative.  Sand Traxx are made of high quality leather, have an anti-slip sole, an orthotic arch support, and are super comfortable.  They are made in the same factory as other top national brands (which we are not supposed to name).  The pledge amount is less than the price you would have to pay for these brands, and they do not even offer the ability to leave a message.  In the very unlikely event you are not satisfied with your Sand Traxx, your pledge will be refunded to you.Each pair will come with two sets of alphabets, 8 spaces, as well as two each of: 1,&,#,$,? and two hearts. Sand Traxx will come in US men's sizes 8-13.  We will send a survey after the campaign to find out what sizes you need.

OOPS!  We made a mistake on the pledge amount of the Wedding Party Special.  It should be $289.  Since someone has already ordered it, we cannot change the number.  If you would like to order it, go ahead and we will refund you the difference.                                                                                         Have fun on the beach!!!Initially we will offer the dark brown as seen at the bottom of the photo above.  If we raise $15,000 we will offer black, and if we raise $20,000 we will add medium brown.                                                                        These are the characters you will receive.  Remember they are in a mirror image so they will read in the sand when you walk.                                          Sand Traxx also come with a cotton bag.  Bring your extra letters to the beach, so you can change them at any time.What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $10,000 minimum to cover the costs of remaking the mold for the characters.  (they need to be a bit thinner) we also want to make the mold so that when we cut the letters apart, there is no scrap to throw away (be nice to mother nature).  Also, they money will go toward our flip flop manufacturers minimum order quantity.  While the products are made overseas, final assembly which includes adhering the velcro to the soles and letters, as well as the cutting apart of the letters will take place at our facility in Minnesota.  
For your pledge you will receive a pair of Sand Traxx, 72 characters , and a cotton bag.  That's an amazing 75 pieces!  



Referral Program
For every $500  worth of pledges you refer to us, we will be happy to send you a free pair of Sand Traxx.




  
The Impact
 Make a statement without saying a word!
Please help make it possible for those who may not have the confidence to say it out loud, at least make their mark and have fun while doing so.
 
  Risks & Challenges While our suppliers have high capacities, we may run into a scheduling problem.  When we get closer to the end of the campaign, we can reserve production time.  Once we get the sandals, letters and velcro, we take care of adhering the velcro on the sole of the flip flops and the back of the characters, and then we take those to Jet Edge to get them cut apart with a cool machine that cuts using water jets, hence the name I guess.
Stretch Goals
$15000 We will add black 



$20000 We will add medium brown



  Other Ways You Can Help If your are reading this and have decided not to pledge, you must at least think it's kind of cool, so we would appreciate if you would share this with those who you think may like this product.  Please use the indiegogo sharing tools to share with your friends.


Three members of our team pictured in front of the Jet Edge waterjet cutting machine that we use to cut our letters and characters:  Founder Jeff Wagener, Partner Jude Lague, and Head of Marketing Nancy Lauseng.

We have just been featured in the Minneapolis Star Tribune!  Check it out!
http://www.startribune.com/waconia-sod-farmer-c...

story:
Stella IIII Sunglasses Story

The Pepper Jacques Stella IIII Sunglasses, started as a random design, on a sketch depicting a swimsuit.  Drawing oversized accessories as a design element always occurs naturally for us.  It’s usually the first design feature that comes to mind, when creating clothing designs.  One day while discussing the details on the L’WREN swimsuit sketch, the discussion resurfaced on how fabulous the sunglasses were.  We decided to find a way to bring them to life. 


Pepper Jacques’ goal with our clothing has always been to use the best materials and techniques to create an effortless merger of art and function.  So our team set out to create our Stella IIII Sunglasses with the same level of refinement.  We started researching the elements that made a pair of sunglasses the most effective and introduced those elements into the design.  Next, we sought out the highest quality materials with a focus on utilizing renewable elements.  Finally, we pursued the world’s best craftsmen to take the sunglasses off the page. In the end our team produced the Stella IIII Sunglasses, a merger of sophistication with the best in optical technology.  

The Stella IIII Sunglasses are available in four colors: Smoke Midnight, Dawn, Grey Skye and Pink Horizon.  We are especially proud of Pink Horizon because 100% of the proceeds from the sale of these sunglasses will go toward helping breast cancer patients and survivors.  This was especially important to us as we watched our mother fight breast cancer. We knew that we had a responsibility to help the fight towards eradicating cancer.

Developing our sunglasses has been an incredible journey and now we are ready for the next step, which is to bring the Stella IIII Sunglasses to you.  In order to cover the up front production cost, we will need your help.

As you learn more about Stella, Try On Stella IIII via our Virtual  Try On


Perks of supporting Pepper Jacques

Pepper Jacques needs your backing to finalize and execute the production process.  The money that we raise from this campaign will go towards

  • Building the molds to produce the Stella IIII Sunglasses
  • Verification of production quality so that you receive the best product
  • Designing and manufacturing environmentally friendly packaging right here in NY
  • Production of the Stella sunglasses and packaging
  • Final assembly and shipping

For your extraordinary support we have assembled the following perks. 

Stella IIII Virtual  Try On. Find your favorite pair now.



Risks & Challenges

Our Pepper Jacques team has been hard at work on the Stella IIII sunglasses for over a year; perfecting the shape, fit, and function.  At this point we have flushed out the kinks in development process.  The potential risk area for us is moving to a large-scaled mass production process that yields the same level of quality we have come to expect.  We have built into our schedule, quality control checks to mitigate this risk.

Pepper Jacques has over 25 years of combined experience in product development and retail.  We know what flags to look for during the production process.  Therefore we will ensure that we are on target for a successful execution.

Other Ways You Can Help

A contribution is not the only way you can help:

  • Share our campaign with everyone you know on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn
  • Show your friends and family how amazing you look in your Stella IIII sunglasses via the Stella IIII Virtual  Try On.
  • Email your friends so they don't miss out on the Stella IIII campaign

story:
My Story

Background

Subtle Eccentricity was birthed in 2013 as I transitioned my jewelry-making from a hobby into a business. In a world of flashing lights and "bigger is better" ideals, Subtle Eccentricity is all about understated designs. My statement pieces aren't necessarily big and bold, but they carry meaning. In the midst of truly modest origins, each piece is carefully handcrafted...usually as I lie on the floor of my bedroom  Dallas studio.

Relaunch

After doing some research, finding my niche, and hearing from God (as well as family, friend and some of the fellas), I'm ready to take things to the next level! Subtle Eccentricity is expanding and will relaunch in the fall of 2015. This project will include:

  • Expanded, cohesive product lines,
  • A complete accessories collection for the gentleman, 
  • A complete collection of Biblically-inspired products, and
  • A collection inspired by my journey through a personal illness and created from donated jewelry. (As Subtle Eccentricity is dedicated to giving back, the proceeds from this particular collection will be donated to local non-profit organizations. Learn more here.)

What I Need & What You Get

Here's where YOU come in. So far, I have been able to fund all Subtle Eccentricity functions, but with adding more products and projects, I need your help! Through this campaign I am hoping to raise $3,000 for:

  • Part-time personnel: because teamwork makes the dream work!
  • Production costs & equipment: more products = more materials
  • Marketing costs: promotional tools & maintenance
The work has already begun to make Subtle Eccentricity's expansion happen. Your contribution will serve as a springboard to ensure the success of this project.
Now, to the good stuff! Here's what's in it for you: In exchange for your contribution, you will receive a handcrafted Subtle Eccentricity item from the Fall 2015 campaign prior to its debut. Based on your donation, you will receive one of the corresponding perks listed below.

$10 Perks

  • Jordan Wrap Ring
  • Salt + Light Necklace
  • Brent Lapel Pin
  • Lone Star Earrings
  • Motherland Earrings


$25 Perks

  • Angela Cuff
  • Zora Cuff
  • Solomon Bracelet
  • Roman Bracelet
  • Lone Star Necklace
  • Lone Star Tie Bar
  • Lone Star Lapel Pin (either tie tack or stick pin)
  • Motherland Necklace
  • Motherland Tie Bar
  • Motherland Lapel Pin (either tie tack or stick pin)


$50 Perks

  • Danard Bracelet Stack
  • Prisca Necklace and Earrings Set


$75 Perks

  • Ashanti Earrings and Handchain Set
  • Noah Bracelets and Lapel Pins Set


$100 Perk
Collector's Kit

Start your very own Subtle Eccentricity collection! Choose from any of the $10-$75 perks (up to $100).

What If I Don't Reach the Goal?

I have faith in you and in this project, so I don't see this happening. However, in the event that the goal is not reached, any funds raised will still go towards the expansion plan, which will be scaled accordingly.

What If The Goal is Exceeded?

That would blow my mind! I have a stretch goal of $5000, as I am interested in leasing studio space. Any additional funds will go towards space, as well as the overall enhancement of products and the customer experience.

The Impact

"People don't buy what you do. They buy why you do it." 
-Simon Senek

 As stated in the video and on the SE blog, Subtle Eccentricity is much bigger than jewelry. It's all about having a Kingdom mindset and making a social impact. The modus operandi for this just so happens to be handcrafted accessories.

The mission of Subtle Eccentricity is to:

  • Share and exemplify Jesus,
  • Provide quality products and a captivating customer experience, and
  • Give, serve, and foster positive social influence.

With your help, Subtle Eccentricity's mission will be furthered and more lives will be impacted!

For more information on Subtle Eccentricity's background, head over to the website to check out the SE101 blog posts.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't contribute financially, doesn't mean that you can't help!

  • Help spread the word and make some noise about Subtle Eccentricity's campaign! Share this campaign on social media, on your website, via email, snail mail, word of mouth, carrier pigeon, or whatever other creative communication method you can come up with. You can also use Indiegogo's share tools.
  • Donate your used or broken jewelry for the Reclaimed collection! Visit the Subtle Eccentricity website, and complete the interest form.

story:
We’re so close to finalizing the Sustainable for Life Project. But we can’t do it without you. Get on board as we create safe, sustainable employment opportunities for women in Kenya who are living with HIV and AIDS.

Our Mission

The collapse of the Rana Plaza Factory, home to 5 garment factories in Bangladesh, exposed the perils of fast fashion on a global scale. On April 24, 2013, the building came crashing down, killing 1,134 workers and injuring thousands.

The price we’re paying for fashion is far too high.

The Sustainable for Life Project is changing how we manufacture goods by creating a sustainable model that benefits everyone. With the help of Dr. Debra Akre of Tembo Trading, a non-profit whose aim is to educate and transform the lives of Kenya children and their communities, we’re bringing small manufacturing to remote areas with previously no or little industry.

July 25th through August 8th we will travel to Ngong, Kenya for the final installation of Sustainable for Life Project. This program employs women with HIV and AIDS and women who live in rural villages. 

In order to create sustainable work for them, Marko Taylor Handbags has decided to have its Fall Collection of leather goods produced by these women. Tembo Trading will teach and provide them with the appropriate tools.  

The benefits will be far reaching. Through sustainable employment their children can attend school. They can buy food and medicine for their families. They can achieve independence and experience a greater sense of purpose. Every woman who produces a Marko Taylor piece will receive a wage that is above the local average and Tembo Trading will automatically put 10% of their earnings into savings for them.

Together we can create a better business model for the fashion industry. Become a part of the Sustainable for Life Project now by joining us as we bring sustainable work practices, employment and ultimately, dignity to as many women in Kenya as possible.

PERKS, get yours now!  

Join the team by purchasing one of our perks now! We are grateful for all contributions and mentions to the campaign. When you order one the following perks it will serve us twofold, the money significantly gets us closer to our goal and secondly, we get to share a sample of our products with you and in turn you can share them with your friends.  

Teammates get privileges! All perks purchased and contributions over $25 will get a coupon for 25% off your first purchase from our new fall collection. What does that really mean? Well, by joining now and being a part of getting this project completed, you could save over $100 dollars on your next purchase for just a $25 dollar contribution or perk!  

 

About The Team

Marc Palmer, Fashion Hope, CEO The facilitator of the sustainability project in Ngong Kenya. 

"We are so excited about this partnership to bring employment to Kenya with Marko Taylor. To see a long awaited dream be so close to becoming a reality"- Marc Palmer

Emmanuel Belliveau, Designer/Co-owner of Marko Taylor Bags.The brand behind the initial program.

 "I always knew I would go back to Africa. 7 years ago, I left Kenya admiring the people's perseverance and wanted to go back with something to offer. A successful NGO is one that is no longer needed. We have lots of work to do to accomplish that and this project is inline with giving the people independence." - Emmanuel

Together, they will be going to Kenya to complete the next stage in the sustainability project with Tembo Trading. On this trip, they will be introducing and developing a new line of products with the women.  


How funding helps:

$2500 for leather and canvas fabric

$300 for dust bag fabric and materials

$800 for hardware (buckles, D rings etc)

$500 for design and 3D printing

$3000 for website and social media marketing

$2600 for airfare for 2 to Kenya (If you are interested in donating sky miles, airmiles or aeroplan please contact us regarding at drakre@hotmail.com)

$800 for Hotel Accommodations for 2.

$100 for Travel Visas

$300 for Meals

 $550 for In-country travel expenses.

TOTAL: $  11,550.00

Extra money raised will go to further improving the working environment - additional lighting, ventilation etc.

Any fees not raised will be for out of pocket by team members going.

Sneak Peak at the Fall Collection!

story:
uGALE is an unique app-controlled insole designed to keep your feet cool, ventilated and odor-free. It can warm up your feet too.


Are you suffering from warm and sweaty feet? Cheesy foot odour? Or having icy toes? uGALE-insole is your remedy! 





As featured on:


Imagine how great it would be if you could wear your favorite shoes at any time of the year without having to worry about  warm, cold or smelly and sweaty feet..

During summers or (sport)activities they would keep your feet cool, fresh and dry. 

The same shoes would keep your feet warm and comfortable in the cold outdoors. 

Or odor-free at any given occasions

In the spring of last year our team conducted a survey on the side effects of wearing closed-toe shoes for an extended period of time. The results were inspiring and became the starting point of our current project. Participants unanimously pointed out that, despite the various attempts of shoe manufacturers, no one actually succeeded in recreating the fresh feeling of being barefoot.

We believe that we are the first to overcome this obstacle. uGALE is a high-tech insole, which we have designed to address this kind of problem.

Our initial brainstorming lead to a few ideas. The first one included the use of an external fan; unfortunately we soon came across some problems, such as strong vibrations, noises, high power consumption and inefficiency.

Thus, we tried our next option, which was implementing an air pump into the heels of shoes. The air flow would be created simply by walking around, but this also meant that the air flow would stop from the moment we stood still or sat down.

Though these experiments were unsuccessful they inspired us to create something completely new, while using the latest technology: in October 2014 began the construction and testing of the uGALE prototype. And now, we are pleased to announce a fully working product.

The combination of power and freshness of a gale (very strong wind) with compact, easy fit insoles - uGALE!




"What's that cheesy smell?!"

As we all know, it's easier and much cheaper to prevent a disease than threating it!

Shoes are one of the main reasons why people suffer from fungal and bacterial foot conditions. When sweat from your feet evaporates, it takes away the heat, while cooling down the feet. But this is impossible when you are wearing closed-in shoes. Wearing shoes prevents natural perspiration, which causes overheating of the feet and high humidity of the skin.

A warm and moist skin becomes a breeding ground for fungal skin infections, which causes deseases such as mycosis, athlete’s foot, dermatophytosis, plantar wart or intertrigo. At the same time warm and moist skin also promotes the growth of bacteria that produce an unpleasant odor.  

Using uGALE you can fundamentally eliminate the root cause of all ills - the lack of air circulation inside your shoes.

Ventilation

The main part of uGALE is the ductwork which distributes the injected air by micro a compressor to the most inaccessible areas of the foot. The size and shape of the duct is designed in such a manner that it evenly covers the entire sweaty area.

Heating

By connecting uGALE insoles with the dedicated app, you can warm up the insoles up to 40°C - 104°F separately. The temperature is adjustable to your own preferences.

Wearing comfort

The underlying principle of the design of uGALE is the unpretentiousness for everyday use. By using the finest materials we made the insoles light and comfortable to wear. We took into account all physiological characteristics of the feet in the development, making uGale comfortable and safe to wear:

 Wireless charging

Further we added wireless charging station by default, giving uGALE owners additional using convenience. We used inductive charging technology and increased the transmitting distance up to 30mm to make uGALE hassle-free in daily life. Users dont need to take the insoles out of shoes anymore, just put the shoes on the charging station for instant charge.

iOS/Android app

Also has been fully thought of control system. It combines a full automatic operation or manual control via smartphone using bluetooth 4.0.

Step 1:                                                                                   

Once you’ve got your insoles download the uGALE control app on your smartphone. Switch the on/off button of the insole, launch the app and connect it with your smartphone by using bluetooth.

Step 3:

Put the uGALE insoles in your shoes

Step 2:

Adjust the temperature(heat) or the airflow rate to your desire.

Step 4:

Check and monitor your battery level on the uGALE app.

  • Electronics in water resistant cover
  • Low noise and vibration levels 
  • Adjustable air flow 
  • Adjustable heat temperature
  • 10+ hrs operation at one charge 
  • Bluetooth 4.0 control via iOS/Android app 
  • Shock absorbing areas on heel and toe
  • Arch support for balance and posture
  • Humidity and temperature sensors
  • 3 axis accelerometer and gyroscope
  • Wireless charging



Fitting the heating and ventilating system in such a small size was a real challenge to us.We had to redesign the inner of the insole in a manner that it would allow the system to work seamlessly without affecting the wearing comfort.

Although we are professional developers,we also have experience in manufacturing.The only risks that may arise are small delays in manufacturing.

We promise you to keep our campaign transparent and we will openly communicate with our supporters, we will share all our efforts, the progress we make and the issues that might arise
story_txt:
uGALE is an unique app-controlled insole designed to keep your feet cool, ventilated and odor-free. It can warm up your feet too.
Are you suffering from warm and sweaty feet? Cheesy foot odour? Or having icy toes? uGALE-insole is your remedy! 





As featured on:




Imagine how great it would be if you could wear your favorite shoes at any time of the year without having to worry about  warm, cold or smelly and sweaty feet..


During summers or (sport)activities they would keep your feet cool, fresh and dry. 



The same shoes would keep your feet warm and comfortable in the cold outdoors. 


Or odor-free at any given occasions






Wouldn't  it be a nice pair of shoes? With uGALE it now has become a reality!







In the spring of last year our team conducted a survey on the side effects of wearing closed-toe shoes for an extended period of time. The results were inspiring and became the starting point of our current project. Participants unanimously pointed out that, despite the various attempts of shoe manufacturers, no one actually succeeded in recreating the fresh feeling of being barefoot.
We believe that we are the first to overcome this obstacle. uGALE is a high-tech insole, which we have designed to address this kind of problem.
Our initial brainstorming lead to a few ideas. The first one included the use of an external fan; unfortunately we soon came across some problems, such as strong vibrations, noises, high power consumption and inefficiency.
Thus, we tried our next option, which was implementing an air pump into the heels of shoes. The air flow would be created simply by walking around, but this also meant that the air flow would stop from the moment we stood still or sat down.
Though these experiments were unsuccessful they inspired us to create something completely new, while using the latest technology: in October 2014 began the construction and testing of the uGALE prototype. And now, we are pleased to announce a fully working product.
The combination of power and freshness of a gale (very strong wind) with compact, easy fit insoles - uGALE!

Step 3:
Put the uGALE insoles in your shoes
Step 2:
Adjust the temperature(heat) or the airflow rate to your desire.
Step 4:
Check and monitor your battery level on the uGALE app.

Adjustable air flow 
Adjustable heat temperature
10+ hrs operation at one charge

story:
Kids Prize Pack is focused on helping children all over the country build a strong love and desire to read. Studies have shown that a large percentage of kids who claim to “Hate” reading say it is because they can’t find anything interesting to read. Our goal at Kids Prize Pack is to provide a Unique and Fun solution to this problem.

Every Kids Prize Pack will include an Age and Gender appropriate Book, Toys, Games, and an assortment of other items. We choose a New Theme each month and base all included items on it. Our thoughts are that if a child enjoys playing with the Amazing Toys and Games, than they will also want to read the Book on the same subject. This means your child will be reading more often and will quickly learn to love reading.


EARN AMAZING PRIZES AND FREE KIDS PRIZE PACKS JUST FOR SHARING!

When you refer your friends and help spread the word about our campaign, we want to make sure you are Rewarded for Your Efforts! We have setup two Referral Programs (below) to make sure you are getting the Best Rewards Possible!

1. Our Referral Progression Program gives you a chance to get Free Kids Prize Packs every time someone you Refer to Us gets a Perk $35 or higher. You can win up to A Years Worth of Free Kids Prize Packs!

2. Our Top 3 Awards are given to those who share us on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, and Instagram the most. You can also e-mail and text our Links to your Family and Friends! Be sure to use #KidsPrizePack and all the sharing tools from this site!


    *You must be logged into your IndieGoGo account for accurate tracking. Visit this link for more information how how to check your stats and make sure each share counts.



Don’t have the Time or Money to waste going to the store and paying retail every time your children want a new toy or book? We have got you covered! We work closely with the Best Companies in the Industry so we can bring you Fantastic Items well below retail. The best part is that you don’t even have to drive in the rain to get it! Your children will get weeks of entertainment from each Kids Prize Pack. Our monthly Themes also allows each Kids Prize Pack to feel completely original so your kids will always look forward to getting their next one.







 

  • Step 1. Choose the Kids Prize Pack that is Right for You. We have 4 categories to choose from based on Age and Gender: Boys 4-8, Girls 4-8, Boys 9-12, and Girls 9-12.

  • Step 2. Our Team will spend countless hours putting together the Perfect Kids Prize Pack for You!

  • Step 3. Watch your kids Open and Fall in Love with their New Kids Prize Pack every month!




As we mentioned before, Every Kids Prize Pack will come with an Age and Gender appropriate Book. These can include both Popular Well Known Titles and some New Discoveries that may not have hit shelves yet! We coordinate our selections with local Teachers, Librarians, and Reading Specialists to ensure your kids will Love every Book they receive..



To launch our product, we need to design custom shipping boxes that will be able to hold all of the included items and feature our brand. This requires significant upfront investments to get everything designed, produced, and available for use.

We will also use a portion of the Funding to acquire some great items from Non-Partner Companies. We are dedicated to providing the best and highest quality items and sometimes that means leaving our comfort zone to find them. As our Company grows so will the products we have in inventory. This means we will need additional team members to help source and ship all of our Kids Prize Packs.

Finally we will need to get more Artwork and Professional Photography done to help us Advertise our products. We have an Amazing In House Artist but he needs food and tools to keep creating his Masterpieces.


Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your Friends about US! Word of mouth is a powerful tool and can help us hit our Subscription Goals! Send E-Mails, Texts, Pick up the Phone, we even advocate Shouting it from the Rooftops!


Risks:

As a subscription box service our risks remain very Low. We have taken every precaution to ensure that we will be able to produce a high quality and long lasting service. Other than the unpredictable Random Acts of God we will be here for you come rain or shine.

story:
Barsun stands for Cool designs, High quality and Ethical Sourcing

 1) Cool designs: Barsun is about enjoying summer, seizing the moment, having fun and being proud of it. Our shorts feature bright colors with fun and original patterns. We offer you up to 16 eye-catching designs.

 2) High quality: Micro fresh technology that ensures quick dry, improved breathability and maximum comfort.

 3) Ethical Sourcing: We care about the world, we all should!! Ethical sourcing safeguards against discrimination and harassment in the workplace, promotes transparent and lawful wage practices and advocates fair labor practices that are non-exploitative and free of forced labor. It also focuses on environmental management, including energy consumption, water use, waste management and pollution prevention.

Barsun is proudly made in Barcelona, so we care about our Mediterranean sea.

Sadly, our sea has high density of plastics comparable to the areas known as "plastic soups" of the Pacific: one piece for every 4 m2

Plastic has been found in all the marine areas of the Mediterranean: beaches, rocky coasts, in the water column and on the seabed, to depths of 3,000 meters. i.e. 72% of garbage collected on the Spanish Mediterranean beaches is plastic.

More than 1,300 species, such as cetaceans, fish, birds or sharks, have been impacted by marine litter. There are several studies that say that in 2050 there will be more plastic than fish in the oceans. Species such as the loggerhead turtle in the Mediterranean are already threatened.

Barsun needs your support so please join our Indiegogo Challenge.

For every swim short we sell, we plan to clean 1 kg of plastic from our sea. We have been inspired by 4Ocean NGO (https://4ocean.com/) and we want to accomplish a similar challenge.

We love the summer and we love our sea, so we want to make our contribution to preserve it.

Our goal is to sell 1000 swim shorts and clean 1 Ton of plastic this summer. If we achive it we will relase a new limited edition design #Logerhead_Turtle.

 

The shorts feature bright colors with fun and original patterns. In our Indigogo campaign we offer up to 16 eye-catching designs, limited only 50 units of each  .  The swim short comes with a matching bag.  

 

We believe in ethical production. That’s why we have looked for suppliers capable of meeting our values. We spotted a family owned factory in Barcelona where artisans love the work they do. By producing in this area we are empowering local industry, reducing transport distances and ensuring premium product quality.

Delivery Dates: Delivery of your Barsun swim shorts will occur during the month of June. 

International Shipping costs: We ship worldwide. Shipping charges will vary depending on destination and will be shown when you choose your reward. We have tried to keep our shipping costs as low as possible.

Your Design + Size: After you make your donation, you will receive an email from a Barsun representative asking you for your selected design, size and shipping address.

Thank you! We appreciate your support. Don't forget to enjoy the summer and be proud of it!

Stay tuned on Kickstarter and Instagram 
@barsunbarcelona

The Barsun Team. 

ANY QUESTIONS?

Send us an email to info@barsunbarcelona.com

Risks and challenges

Please note that the specifiactions may be subject to minor design tweaks during the production process to make it a better final product. If there are any significant design changes or any unforseen complications we will keep all backers informed via Indiegogo and through our social media network.

story:
SIDIKAI IS BORN FROM A LIFELONG PASSION FOR DESIGN AND THE BELIEF IT IS EVERYONE’S DUTY TO BUILD A BETTER WORLD WITH WHAT WE ARE GIVEN.

 

WE CHALLENGE THE WHOLE PRODUCTION PROCES TO INCORPORATE CIRCULAR ECONOMY PRINCIPLES EVERY STEP OF THE WAY.

 

 

SIDIKAI IS NOT FUNDED BY "BIG MONEY".

WE ARE FUNDED ONLY BY THE PEOPLE WHO WANT TO MAKE CHANGE HAPPEN.

 

We are firmly committed to our creative identity and sustainable principles. We dont want other interests to drive our decision making so our funding comes exclusively from those who share our vision and and believe their choices can trully make a difference.

 

"Revolution only succeeds by empowering the few to become the many."
